reviews.text: Great value

I have purchased several times via Uber Eats and each time the food has gotten worse. I only kept trying because Sun Ning used to be really good but that's it for me. Disgusting, old tasting, poor service, cold food and expensive for what it is. What a shame to see the Sun Ning become this. The people that started it really did a great job with the most basic of food, and the place can no longer provide even that.
We loved the food, perfect taste and full yummy,. Highly recommended
Very good value for money. üòäüëçüèªüëå

Large variety of Chinese food and Fish & Chips. The service is always efficient.
Fish & Chips: Fish batter is crispy, chips are clean and delicious. Hotdog is a saveloy if you like that.
Chinese meal: Always end up getting Beef (steak) & black bean and the combination fried rice. Both a HUGE, full of meat and veges. Always lasts us a few meals given how big they are, and yet all very reasonably priced. Our local go-to Fish & chip shop and Chinese place.
Great prices excellent food
Absolutely delicious food and good amount of food for the price as well

Sun Ning is AMAZING!! We drove across town to try it and it will be our new go to for great Chinese food. The servings are super generous, there is a lot of meat and they are big pieces too, they were very reasonably priced, the chicken chowmein and chicken and cashew were loaded with meat as well as heaps of delicious veges. The beef in the fried rice was so tender. The sweet and sour pork was still a little bit crunchy which was lovely, with a perfectly balanced sweet but tangy sauce, and delicious won tons too. Thoroughly enjoyed, thank you! Also very busy at 6pm so is a good sign, and seemed to be quick cooking and getting the food out to customers. Top marks from us.
The paneer bhurji is always good but tonight it was probably the best Indian food I‚Äôve ever had. Incredible fresh flavours and spices. Highly recommend trying this.
Our favourite Indian place in Christchurch!! Best service and yummy food everytime !!

Bhuna lamb curry, worst I've ever had, uneatable, sour onion flavour.phone them to give feedback. all i got was sorry and hung up on. Totally disappointing service and food. Nan was small and no cheese like ordered.
The best Indian food in Christchurch by far. I love Indian, and have been to many around the city and South Island, this one is the best.

Always good to find a good curry. Have been told to try it many a time and no regrets. Great food and service. Will definitely go again as being english always good to find a good curry even if its a bit out of the way

Delicious curry‚Äôs from Ferry Indian!  I‚Äôve
only tried them through takeouts but still thoroughly impressed with quality and quantity!!

I‚Äôve been told I should dine in! Apparently very cosy/intimate dining vibe, can‚Äôt wait to try!

Love this place! The food‚Äôs always amazing and never disappoints. The vibe is super chill and welcoming, and the staff are absolute legends, always friendly, smiling and on to it with the service.
Always hits the spot! I‚Äôve been here heaps of times and it‚Äôs consistently awesome. If you‚Äôre after good food, good vibes and good value, you can‚Äôt go wrong with Tanoshi. Definitely one of the best feeds in town!
Staff is very accommodating and friendly
The food was superbly crafted with a lot of love. Super tasty. Warm and friendly service as well. Definitely recommended.
Best Japanese ramen we had in a while! Highly recommend
Amazin food Trust the chef Just do it

If I could give more stars, I would! The most gracious and friendly hospitality from all staff the moment we walked in the door, to the moment we left. The food - absolutely everything was SENSATIONAL! We had a variety of food on the table ( the konkatsu was my personal favourite). Loved all the salads, the Ramen, the pancake and the takoyaki balls. The wonderful staff also surprised my son with singing Happy Birthday, and matcha tirimasu. This place is phenomenal üôå Thank you Tanoshi

This restaurant was just around the corner of my stay. Didn't have a good experience with 2 other Thai restaurants I tried some time back. This one just hit the right notes for me.
I tried Thai red curry with medium spice levels(which doesn't come with rice had to order separately), which should be good for 2 light eaters. I am going back for more for sure. Like some other reviews mention, they could have a combo option for solo travellers.
The place is bit cramped, I was bit early so didn't have problem finding a seat. Definitely recommend for those Thai food lovers.

The restaurant was only 5 minutes walk from our hotel and opened on Monday night. The place was super busy and every table was full so we were there at the right time.
We had 2 cocktails to shared. I had a basil chilli crispy pork with rice while my husband had a tofu veggie peanut sauce stir-fry with rice. The food was delicious but massive üòÇ we were so full before we could get through the whole plate so had to skip the dessert!
The lady who look after the door and casher was super friendly and calm with the crazy paces of people come and go and needed to go to the threter!
The restaurant is in a beautiful colourful stripe üåàüåÉ
Friendly staff and great food.  Better than your average thai food.

The Nook Thai Eatery in Christchurch isn't just good; it's an experience. As someone who's sampled Thai cuisine extensively, I can confidently say this was not only the best Thai food I've ever had but also ranks among the most exceptional meals of my life. The dishes were a symphony of flavors, expertly crafted and bursting with freshness.

Beyond the incredible food, the staff's warmth and attentiveness truly stood out. Their genuine smiles and dedication to customer satisfaction created a welcoming and delightful atmosphere. Fawn (the owner) was incredibly sweet and a lovely person overall!

Without hesitation, I will be returning to The Nook Thai Eatery and enthusiastically recommending it to anyone visiting Christchurch. Do yourself a favor and prepare for a truly unforgettable meal.

One of the worst dinning experience of our life. There were ANTS in our food. We ordered fried rice but was served with live ants. When we notified the server, she went to kitchen and bring the same rice back. She said that she just took the ants out of it.

Just imagine, they had the audacity to serve the same rice that had ants crawling. Taking them out does not mean they did not left their dirt on the rice.

Not apologetic at all. We lost all our appetite and did not had courage to wait to see other dishes that we ordered and left.
Fantastic - great service, great atmosphere, staff were awesome and so accommodating, especially considering our VERY large group booking.

Booking was easy on-line.
Placement of our large group (16 adults) was great.
Staff were awesome, particularly the young lady who looked after us. She was organised, effective, timely, very good communicator and very pleasant and affable.
They catered to all food requirements, and the food was superb - not one issue from any of us.
This was our third visit in several years, would definitely go back there again and highly recommend Casa Republica as a place to dine and socialise.
Great atmosphere. Love it!

Positioned right beside the tram tracks and in a vibrant busy lane, this South American inspired restaurant offers cuisine from various locations from that region of the World. Friendly service, but  food was average and could improve.
This place was OK. Food was a bit overpriced. We never had one wait staff, so was a bit more difficult to get service.

amazing, good service, the crispy chicken poke bowl is so so fresh and is a great option for lunch. good price, nice location and the perfect spot for a fresh light meal. that sweet chilli changed my life üßë‚Äçüç≥üíã
Best sushi in Christchurch
Excellent service! Su always greets us with a big smile. The sushi is fresh, expertly prepared, and offered at the best prices.
Best sushi and service in Christchurch.
Such lovely staff and yummy food ‚ù§Ô∏è
I love this place because it is quiet (no loud music and you can hear yourself think). Food is great and good value too
Huge range of great sushi and other Japanese food, friendly staff, fair prices
I had sushi court a couple of weeks back, and it was great! I really liked the self service, and the variety of dishes available.
Best Indian restaurant in christchurch, really like it
The best Indian restaurant I've been to in Christchurch. Will definitely be back again
The overall experience are good. The staffs are all very friendly, helpful with answering questions regarding the dishes. All the dishes are unique in taste. The dessert was interesting to try!
Food was excellent. Highly recommend it.
FAMILY MEAL was delicious - good serving amounts, very tasty, beautifully cooked and presented with great attention from staff.

Honestly, quite disappointed with the overall experience. The food was way below average compared to other restaurants, especially considering their higher prices. The curry had an unusually strong color, which made it look artificial, and the taste was almost bland.

What really stood out was the hospitality ‚Äî it felt noticeably friendlier toward local customers than towards us. No one even asked how the food was, and most of the attention seemed focused on impressing the locals.

To add, this wasn‚Äôt our first odd experience here. A few years ago, we walked in and were told there were no tables available unless we had a booking. Just out of curiosity, my wife called them right after we stepped out, and suddenly, they said a table was available. When we went back in, they realized their mistake and apologized, but the whole situation felt quite uncomfortable ‚Äî almost as if they didn‚Äôt really want us there in the first place.

Overall, not a place I‚Äôd return to or recommend. There are plenty of restaurants around offering much better food, value, and respect for all customers.

Update on your response

Thank you for your response. I understand you may see things differently, but I‚Äôve simply shared my honest experience as a paying customer. It‚Äôs disappointing that instead of taking the feedback constructively, the reply came across as defensive and personal.

Also, thank you for taking the time to look into my Facebook account to find my mutual friends ‚Äî that level of effort says a lot in itself.

Regardless of what your internal notes or assumptions might say, my experience at the table didn‚Äôt feel welcoming ‚Äî and as a customer, that‚Äôs what matters most. Feedback is meant to help improve service, not start a debate or a personal investigation.

I wish your team the best and hope future customers have a better experience.
Lovely food  for birthday party  Lovely  pub to relax
Can be a bit crowded but the food is always amazing.
Finger lickin' good - bubba approves ü§©
Basic food, serviced with a smile in a place that feels really comfy. Thanks guys. We're regulars
Good solid pub meals
Palak Paneer was was amazing. Friendly staff and nice place.

Little India at Spitfire Square were excellent hosts. They looked after our cricket team really well, and everyone left completely satisfied. Lots of food, great hosting and all the food was tasty. Highly recommend!

We had dinner here today and unfortunately found a hair in our food. The taste itself was below average, and the overall experience was quite disappointing. Even after mentioning the issue to the staff, there was no apology or discount offered, which was surprising. We were really expecting better food quality and hygiene, especially from a reputed restaurant chain. Hope they take this feedback seriously and improve their standards.
Very good food and service. Liked Chicken chilli and spring roll.
I had such a great meal that I went back a second time, definitely would recommend
Great meal!  Friendly and kind staffs:) thumbs up for them!

Very friendly staff, we ordered shared platter and rice, not knowing it was an entree and didn't come with curry. They were kind enough to give us some curry to have with the meats. Highly recommended!
Absolutely perfect place and the owner is awesome... maybe I go in there too often because I'm now well known XD either way best Indian restaurant in thus side of town!

One of best places to order or take a way. I ordered food and it was super delicious. They takes little bit of  time because they don‚Äôt keep most of the food and items on the freezer and just heat them and give them to the customers like other restaurants. They cook fresh and give you larger portions and cheaper prices compared to other places. I personally recommend to buy or order food from here if you really want to eat fresh . They even make paneer in an organic way from fresh milk. If you ordered and wait around 15 to minutes then you will be served a healthy, delicious and fresh food. I can‚Äôt wait to eat next time.
I buy most weeks via uber - every week i think this place cant get any better until the next time its even better. By far the best in the South Island
Incredible chicken saag, super fast service and the bro working there is a really cool guy 10/10 definitely going again

I popped in from Google review(we are traveller's from Auckland) Butter chicken was so good and reasonable! (We shared for 1 serve was very enough)
I wish the restaurant was in Auckland!
We regularly order takeaways & have also eaten in. Their food is excellent, quick service, very reasonably priced & nice people.
Very delicious butter chicken
Thank you to the girl at front she looked after us very well. Thank you chef for cooking for us without onion glarlic at last moment. Thank you so much Hare Krishna üôèüôá‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Excellent food, superb price, highly recommend.

The Tom Yum tofu was good. The Tom Kha was not worth getting. The soup base seemed to be only coconut milk, and was overly sweet. The fresh spring rolls were good. A little pricey compared to similar restaurants in CHC.
Friendly service and delicious food
Great service, food was excellent will definitely come back again.

Kum Pun Thai ‚Äì 5‚≠ê
Super friendly staff and great service. The Pad Med Ma-Muang stir-fry was absolutely delicious üòãüëå ‚Äî one of the best I‚Äôve had. Spring rolls could be better (and more for the price), but overall the experience was fantastic, so I‚Äôll let that slide ü§£.

Would love to see later hours on weekends given the casino is right across the road, but still a top spot I‚Äôll be coming back to!

Food is always good and have dined here a few times.  But disappointed last night.  Table booked for 7.30pm.  After 9.15pm no customer service offered to see if more drinks or deserts required.  Just told at 9.20pm that they were closing in 10 minutes.  So, we paid and left.  Not the Friday night dining experience we hoped for.
Warm, cosy and kids friendly!

Slow service when we were inside and drinks took a long time to come. Out of quite a few of the cocktails we wanted and the table beside us too, which was disappointing this wasn‚Äôt indicated before hand. We‚Äôve been to OGB many times before and had positive experiences so maybe this was just an off day.

OGB is absolutely amazing! The outdoor vibe with music on weekends creates such a lively and fun atmosphere, perfect for catching up with friends or just enjoying good company. The staff are genuinely the best, always welcoming, friendly, and they make you feel right at home every time. The drinks are always spot on and beautifully made, and the overall energy of the place is unmatched. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Christchurch!

This place has such a warm and welcoming vibe! The atmosphere is amazing, and the staff are always kind and friendly. I always enjoy going there it‚Äôs the perfect spot to relax, and hang out. Highly recommended! ü´∂üèº

OGB is such a beautiful spot ‚Äî the architecture alone is stunning! We weren‚Äôt quite sure what to expect, but loved discovering how the building has been thoughtfully divided into different businesses, each with its own character. The indoor dining area felt cozy and welcoming, with its mezzanine level and intimate layout. I‚Äôd noted my dietary requirements when booking, and the staff were incredibly accommodating and attentive. The food and drinks were absolutely delicious ‚Äî I‚Äôd highly recommend OGB to anyone visiting Christchurch!
Team are wonderful. From floor staff, the Bartenders and all the way to the Kitchen. Atmosphere is exquisite and such a vibe. Definitely recommend
Pre show dinner. Service was quick and friendly. There were very good choices from the pre show menu. Cooked well and very tasty.

Lovely place to come for a drink with a friend. Speakeasy vibe with cosy tables, ambient lighting, and really great, friendly service from everyone you encounter.
I must add that the fries are top notch!
Breakfast was amazing ü§© full Irish breakfast like home in Ireland me and my mates really enjoy this pub, definitely go there !

Karaok, it used to be great , now they kick people out for drinking water. The security guards are on a huge power trip. Shoving people for no reason. Never showing up again. They also  never do first in first serve for Karaoke I got In early to put my name up first and had to wait over 2 hours to be called up üò†
Nice place, ultra rude lady working. Everyone else was alg, she wasnt

PK served us, He was amazing he accommodated all our needs,
We played some Pool and drink some beers

Went to the toilet, white blonde female behind the bar tried telling me I spent 10-15 mins in the toilet as to why they took me and my partners 2 drinks away, spent 4 mins in the toilet as per timer. Tried charging me for another two drinks when I came to find mine gone, said they had performed two floor sweeps in the time I made a 4 minute phone call and defecation session. Not the first time I‚Äôve found this decrepit place scrounging for any dollar they can. Might as well drink at the Sandridge, friendlier staff, better quality toilets, and they won‚Äôt steal your more than well paid for drinks! White blonde females practices should be reviewed. Nothing like the staff that upheld the Craics good name years ago. Won‚Äôt ever return, no matter how late it‚Äôs open.
Very yummy food. Would recommend.

Lovely little place with quiet, friendly atmosphere & delicious food full of classic & interesting flavours. The duck & homemade pickles were brilliant (and the hotpot (and the beer)).
Cheers
Best Japanese in chch
Quiet experience, family friendly, lovely food and prompt service
It was a bit too long for the waiting and also a bit stingy when we asked for chili powder as we spent quite a lot, but they were not generous and not enough staff
We just live around the corner and decided to come in for dinner. Very cosy atmosphere and the food was absolutely delicious. Service was friendly and helpful.
Ok but food average
Its our fave thai restaurant..

We started our  trip in South Island, New Zealand by having dinner in here. During our 2 weeks trip, this is the best Thai restaurant we ever had. Before we fly back to our home, we finished our trip by having another dinner.
Red curry fish and sweet chilly fish are very recommended as well as the Tom yum soup.

The staffs are very kind.

Really disappointed..been a long time customer of Sema Thai, only to have collected our takeaway, got home and found incorrect order. Rang and then had to argue about what I‚Äôd ordered‚Ä¶then asked if we‚Äôd eaten the incorrect dish, bring it back and collect the right dish.  No apology nothing just ‚Äúwe‚Äôre right you‚Äôre wrong!‚Äù Then to add insult to injury 3 roti ordered, we couldn‚Äôt find the 3rd and yelled at again!! Will never support this business.  Will find another Thai takeaway that actually value their customers!

Don‚Äôt order from here. Foods horrible and false advertising

Bar185 is a great place to hang out in Christchurch. Good vibe, nice atmosphere, and the service was spot on. Samson looked after us really well ‚Äì super friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Definitely worth a visit!
Disappointed‚Ä¶I‚Äôll order on doordash 1 Margherita was show in picture are woodfried and I‚Äôll receive uncooked based like frozen..very bad taste waste of my money
Such a great place and atmosphere, great for a wine and to win on the pokies
Going on their food, should be closed down
Boss was so rude, the shisha was not strong enough. Do not go
Ordered a meatlovers on Uber eats, picture showed a woodfired pizza, what they sent appeared and tasted like a cheap frozen pizza. I would not visit here.
I got the lunch special pad Thai. Quite tasty! I'd come back again and I'd reccommend!
I love beef noodle soupüòò

I came in here around a week ago i come we get seated relatively fast but the table we were seated at was a disaster there was a cup of something on the floor under the table there was some sort of sticky substance all over the table and it was quite cold for our food it was not too bad but it took insanely long to get after we had finished we left quickly and were glad to be gone.

Would not recommend i will never return here.

First time here after reading amazing reviews. Didn't disappoint at all, delici authentic flavors,  warm ambience and great service.  We had Pad see ew and Northern Thai Curry noodles- Khao Soi, even Tried  extra mild medium hot and wow amazing! Highly recommended!
Aroi mak ka! Its alway our favourite noodle soup here ,  so delicious!
Had a really pleasant meal at Chang Thai Restaurant. The food is authentic, and the staff are all very friendly, would highly recommend if you would like to have nice Thai food.
We ordered Clear soup noodles and Massaman curry, both tasted amazing !!! Highly recommend. People are so friendly here :)
Lovely experience, always nice to go here. Food is delicious, attentive staff. Great for a catch up with friends.
Yummy my food! Cocktails great price will definitely be back
Excellent customer service, only down side to our meal were the chips because they were very over seasoned aside from that it was great food highly recommend the beef burger

Highly recommend Pedal Pusher. Delicious food. Great service.
They have First Table which is an added bonus.
We'll be back.
Beautiful tasty Thai food, which we enjoyed again.

I purchased the Tom yum prawn.
It comes down to the attitude and behaviour of the chef, if he or she is having a bad day, your food is going to resemble this.
My Tom Yum was poor, 3 prawns and a piece of mushroom.
I got a bad day, Puck it.

Since I‚Äôm from South East Asia, I‚Äôm longing for proper spicy Thai food. I just visited to Christchurch and found this shop. I ordered Thai spicy level takeaway. It‚Äôs super. The chef lady is so nice.

Really disappointed in our meals tonight.
We always buy thai from here and it's not as good as it normally would be. Was looking forward to it, only to be disappointed.

Good as always.

I ordered a beef death by chilli's and was not spicy at all had nothing of the ingredients in it that was mentioned on the menu. I also got a prawn pad thai and was more of a seafood peanut satay pad thai, it was very peanutty the noodles weren't you're normal thick pad thai noodles they were very thin. The curry puffs were like curry mash wrapped in pastry. I asked for fresh sping rolls and was given fried spring rolls.

The service itself was okay communication barrier was a little difficult as we both struggled to understand each other but having the menu infront to be able to point at what I wanted was helpful. It seemed like a very busy place as when I was being served the person serving me had to keep going away to had out orders or answers the phone.

The place was clean tidy doesn't look like much foot traction comes through but if there were to be people dine in they would probably want to play somthing other than infomercials.

Don't be fooled by the pictures as the look of the pictures definitely does not match the taste of the food. It's not a place I'll be going back to especially if I'm going to be spending over $80 I expect the quality and taste to be some what decent.

We did the long lunch deal on the weekend just been. There was 6 of us at the lunch.
We all ate the same food as it was a set menu. One person who is allergic to seafood swapped out her prawns for a chicken dish. Around 6 hours after leaving the restaurant, 5 of us became ill. Vomiting, stomach cramps, nausea etc. The 5 of us who fell ill were the 5 who ate the prawns. The one person who did not get sick, had the chicken.
I would not have given a 1 star review had the restaurant responded differently to our email letting them know we all got sick. Their response "The staff also ate the prawns and did not get sick".
We without a doubt got food poisoning from this restaurant, we all got sick at the same time, all with the same symptoms. A better response would have been acknowledgment and an apology rather than a denial.

My husband bought chips and fried rice from Asian Take away. When we got home, we found that the chips were burnt. I called and spoke to someone about it. The person on the phone (possibly the owner) admitted they knew the chips were burnt.

I asked why you would knowingly serve burnt food, and there was no clear response.

While a refund was offered, we don‚Äôt want to spend our time going back just to get one. Please be more mindful of how you treat your customers. If something is burnt, don‚Äôt serve it‚Äîget it right the first time.

I was born in England, Chinese food and Indian food were part of my upbringing (as well as British food of course). I've lived all over the West Midlands, Devon and even Derbyshire. I've had many, many a take out because I was either pissed or just couldn't be arsed to cook. I've travelled to Canada, USA, Europe, India, Thailand, Indonisia, Vietnam, bugger me a lot of places. But this Chow Mein from this little freaking taker in Christchurch, IS ABSOLUTELY FREAKING AMAZING. The veg has been cooked perfect, the amount of meat to veg ratio is spot on, the sauce is to die for, the overall portion allows me to have 2 days worth of dinners. The staff were friendly, and the place was packed. I saw several customers bring their own boxes to take away their orders, as they ordered upto 8 items to feed their family. Folks, this place is amazing. I ordered the chow mein as a base line. If this is good then the rest is going to be amazing. Go to this place.

Fabulous food, amazing service and the best atmosphere and setting. Highly recommend the Maharaja Indian restaurant, will definitely be back.

Suresh is absolutely amazing! We dined here for a friend‚Äôs birthday using First Table, and he took the time to clearly explain the T&Cs to our group and even gave thoughtful recommendations based on our tastes.

Unfortunately, we had an issue with the First Table discount when it came to the bill, and one of the female staff members handled it terribly! Speaking rudely about us, right in front of us (not realising one of us understood her language). We also overheard another table complaining about the same staff member‚Äôs attitude, so it clearly wasn‚Äôt just us.

Thankfully, Suresh completely turned the experience around. He was kind, professional, and made sorting out the refund quick and stress-free. If it weren‚Äôt for him, this visit would‚Äôve been a very different story!

Exceptional food and amazing flavours!
We tried the Butter Tikka Masala and Malai Kofta, and both dishes were bursting with rich, balanced spices. The Butter Tikka Masala was creamy and full of depth, and the Malai Kofta was smooth and perfectly seasoned. Also, don‚Äôt forget to try the chilli pickle ‚Äî it adds the perfect spicy tang to the meal.

I honestly wish I could fly back from Australia just to eat here again.
Highly recommended!

We went to Maharaja for our one year anniversary at their new location.
They seated me & husband in a comfy booth close to the loo (as I‚Äôm very pregnant) which was nice of them to sacrifice a bigger table for just the two of us. The Lamb  & biryani & aijwani fish were the stand out dishes for us! We will definitely be back!

One of the best Indian dinners I have had! From start to finish just exquisite. The appetiser chicken omg! The main were so creamy and the dessert hit the spot! Book in treat yourself. Also a bar too :)

Had my daughters 21st in the function room. I would definitely recommend this venue. Great food and the team were very accommodating. Can take your own cake and the minimum spend wasn‚Äôt too high üòä

Enjoyed our weekend dinner there!  Service was very efficient and friendly.  The food prices were fair and it was a very nice jovial atmosphere.  Clearly this is a place where friends and families meet up for a shared meal!  We enjoyed ourselves immensely.  The mushroom halloumi burger was on my mind for days!

We won't be back after a disappointing meal the tacos were so bland nothing more than some coleslaw that had no taste, lamb that needed salt and flavor and what looked like tinned tomatoes it was horrible. The staff member wasn't really interested in my complaint but was still happy to charge for food that wasn't really even touched because it was horrible. The place could do with a good clean and personally im not really into staff that are more interested in being on their phones than working and serving customers. The food is nothing more than overpriced food that you could make at home but 10 times better we ended leaving and going elsewhere.

We were recommended by a load of people to the The Bealey when asking about going to a pub.

We had a really lovely experience, with classic pub food - opting for burgers as there was a Tuesday $20 special on.

Recommend asking to sit out on the deck in the restaurant for this coming summer, there was decent cover and the last of the days sun sent the beers down easy.

The fry on the fish, chicken and chips for the burgers was actually perfect, and made for a pretty great dinner. Chef could be a smidgen heavier on the seasoning, and would love to see citrus with the fish burger to make this a truly classic pub fish dish.

We'll absolutely be back to try some more meals, as they have a lot of amazing Glutenfree choices too.

Amazing, delicious food! Wish I lived in Christchurch so I could eat there more often. Really delicious. They need a bigger store though, for good reason - it was packed when we went!
It was a Wednesday night and the place was busy. Best Malaysian food I've had outside of Malaysia. Even got cans of 100Plus. Worth a detour.

Every time I travel, this is one of the places I never miss. The food here is authentic, delicious, and reminds me so much of home. The portions are very generous, and the prices are really reasonable for the quality and size you get.

What I love most is that it truly feels like eating in Malaysia ‚Äî the flavors are rich, comforting, and bring back so many memories. On my way back, I always make sure to takeaway some food to take home because it‚Äôs just that good.

If you‚Äôre craving real Malaysian food with great value and heartwarming taste, this is the place to go. Highly recommended!

My family and I came here to celebrate my sisters birthday last night. They were very busy, but service was great, Yoshi? (Not sure if this is his name sorry!) Our visit to Corriander‚Äôs was very disappointing. The food was pathetic (below average). Waiting time too long although the restaurant was not too busy. Food lacked flavour and tasted terrible. We wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

We were recommended to go to Coriander's Restaurant whilst visiting Christchurch as we were told they had a very good vegan menu.  We decided to go after a comedy show & arrived at the St Asaph St Corianders at 9.30pm very hungry.  Staff were very welcoming & said they were open until 11pm so we could get a table for two.  We explained that we needed all our food to be Vegan & Gluten-free & they said they could do that.  We ordered vegetable pakoras & onion bhajis for starters & a glass of wine each which was all very delicious.  The waitress bought out a yoghurt sauce with the starters which was quickly whisked away by the head waiter as it had dairy in it.  So we thought that they had the allergies & dietary requirements sorted.  We ordered two curries to share with rice as our main both from the vegan menu & were told that the curries were also GF & Vegan (we always ask several times as this combination is very rarely catered for well at any cafe or restaurant anywhere in NZ).  Everything was absolutely delicious & we were impressed with the soya chunks in the curries (used instead of chicken in the vegan curries), so much so that I asked where I could source it for my Vegan, 99% GF wholefood cafe in Timaru.  I was told by the waiter that it was called Soya Chaap & could get the tins of it at local Indian Supermarket or through food service providers.  Later that night my husband was feeling very uncomfortable with gut pain & bloating & the next day he was not well at all, barely able to function.  He is very intolerant to gluten (basically a coeliac), but we couldn't figure it out as we were sure that Coriander's had catered to our vegan & GF needs.  We decided to go to the Indian Supermarket to buy some of those tins of Soya Chaap & to our great disappointment discovered that they contained not only soy, but gluten wheat flour which was the 1st ingredient.  So as we own a 99% GF cafe, I definitely couldn't use it at all.  We are very hot on making sure the 1% of ingredients that do contain Gluten in our cafe (organic oat milk & organic date scones) do not ever get cross contaminated with the GF ingredients (as my hubby is very intolerant of course).  Anyway, I am very sorry to have to write all of this as we initially were thoroughly impressed with the service & the delicious food but I feel like I had to do this review to let other folks who are GF know that they can't have the vegan curries with the soy pieces in them as not GF.  My hubby was sick enough from just one meal but it could have been much worse for someone with chronic Coeliac Disease.  Suggest staff need more training all round both FOH & Kitchen staff as they may not be aware of the gluten content of the Soya Chaap they are using but it was clearly labelled on the tins of all the different brands at the Indian Supermarket.  We won't be going back unfortunately, which we are very sad about.

I am disappointed and my husband is in pain.

My husband a coeliac works near Herba and was one of his go to eating spots for the last few years.

Unfortunately, the business was sold and has rapidly gone down hill.

The quality of the food has taken a nose dive and the treatment of customers has done the same.
After avoiding the place for a few months after his last dissatisfied experience there. today he went back as he'd received an offer for $5 off.
Big mistake, the protein size has decreased the chips were inconsistently cut and therefore terribly cooked.

And that is not the worst part: The food was contaminated. As a "dedicated GF" facility we expected it to be safe. His current agony tells a different story and I would recommend caution to all other coeliacs

"After preparing and plating the noodle dish and the stir-fry, I had to wait over 40 minutes for the other dish. The noodles became overcooked and lost their texture, making them unappetizing.and food was getting cold.

I had been wanting to order from here for ages after hearing good things about this place from Friends. Finally had the opportunity tonight and my review is a little mixed.

After reading the other reviews I knew that there would likely be a long waiting time for the food. They opened at 4:30pm, and we called through to order at around 5:10pm. They quoted a wait time of 1 hour and 15 minutes. We were happy with this as we had called in early.

The wait time ended up being pretty accurate - which was good service. When my partner came to collect around 6:30ish another person came into order and left pretty quickly after being quoted a 2 hour wait time for food. This seems like a major issue for this place - they can‚Äôt handle many orders as there is only one guy cooking the food.

We ordered mild chicken green curry and chicken Pad Thai. The portion size of the Pad Thai was great and the Pad Thai was good. For $15 this was great value for money but taste wise was not anything amazing.

Unfortunately the big let down for me was the green curry which  was what I was most looking
forward to / craving the most. Green curry is my usual dish at places at little high, thai orchard etc.

On the phone the lady asked if we wanted the curry mild, medium or hot. We said mild and
she repeated back to us that it was mild we were  ordering. My Partner can handle a bit a spice, but I can‚Äôt so I always like to get mild to get a mild spice flavour or no spice at all.

THE CURRY TASTED LIKE SPICY WATER. I‚Äôm certain I was probably given a hot curry by mistake because it was so hot I couldn‚Äôt eat any
of it. My partner also said it was very hot and he couldn‚Äôt have a lot of it due to the bland flavour / texture. I can acknowledge when a dish is spicy and flavourful - however all you could taste was spicy water. It was horrible and went straight into the bin which is a real shame. No nice curry texture, coconut or anything. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the curry even if you could handle the spice. No flavour, bland and tasted awful - the spice didn‚Äôt even match the flavour profile of a typical spicy green curry.

Due to the fuss with the waiting time, probably won‚Äôt come back here again as it‚Äôs not really worth it. Very disappointing :(

Was recommended this place by a freind, it had been playing in my mind to order here as I had tried their lard about three years ago and it was average as. Nonetheless I ordered. We were told 40 mins.

I walked in the store and got the food. After a brief and frisk drive home, the smell of this takeaway wofting into my nostrils had me readily for a goon. I then got home. One sip of the Panang curry, One bite of curry puff, one tear of spare rib.

I knew I‚Äôd hit a gem!

We ordered one garlic naan and one lamb Prata. We were stoked as the garlic naan is very yummy then the lamb prata is even more yummy. The owner is very outgoing and we had lovely chat about Diwali festival while waiting for food getting ready. I was the last the customer, but the owner still preparing and cooking food carefully and patiently.
This is the best Indian takeaway in the eastern bays.

This restaurant is an absolute gem! The food is incredible and the hospitality makes it even better. The owner is one of the kindest, most genuine people I have ever met. He is so welcoming and humble, and you can tell he truly cares about his customers. The chili chicken was out of this world, perfectly spiced, full of flavor, and cooked to perfection. The shahi paneer was just as amazing, rich, creamy, and made with so much love that every bite melts in your mouth. I also tried lamb anar masala and chicken Bhuna masala just loved every bite of that. I never ever had that kind of lamb in my whole life. If you are craving authentic Indian food with top-notch service, this is the place to be. Highly recommend! Also I wanna mention I am from Australia (Sydney) me and my family had best food experience in all over New Zealand. Loved it and thanks to the owner and cooks as well.

You guys should seriously consider opening a franchise because the experience was that good. The owner was incredibly humble and kind, the service was flawless, and the food was absolutely mind-blowing. This was hands down the best Indian food I‚Äôve ever had in my life. Every bite was bursting with authentic flavors and made with so much care. If you‚Äôre looking for a place that truly stands out, this is it.
Highly recommended chilli flakes for best Indian food sooo Damm delicious
Best Indian out these ways.
Best butter chicken in World. My son loves this place food.never disappoints the test . Fresh and flavourful food

Went In this afternoon.
Got one and a half menus because one of them is broken along with dirty glasses.
The food was ok but the atmosphere was terrible, no music just silence and one of the staff talking on the phone.
Bathroom lock was broken and there was clothing on the ground.
When it was time to pay, the guy at the front was on the phone the whole time and it barely acknowledged me.
Great food and great service. Simple food done well ‚úåÔ∏è

It was quiet with one table leaving as we were entering to the restaurant at 5.30 pm.  The place began to get filled up 5 minutes after we sat down. We asked the guys leaving the restaurant how was the food and their quick response were that the food was very good.  We glanced the menu quickly.  We decided to make it easy for two of us and ordered a platter for two.  We did not have lunch but still could not finish all the meat and the fries.  Our comment is that be prepared to be hungry for platter for two.  A staff came and offered a box; relatively friendly and good service. The sausage was good. Meat was tender; it would be better if we could taste a bit more smoky on the meat.  Overall it was good food and tasted good with hands and figures. It would be nice if there was eating gloves or wet napkin as we were spoiled in the restaurants at home.

Tout simplement fantastique. La viande est vraiment exceptionnelle, les accompagnements √©galement. Nous avons pris le plat √† partager √† deux et m√™me √† deux il y avait bien assez de nourriture. Vraiment un pur r√©gal !
We spend a great time. Amazing food, good prices and great service. We will come back soon.

If you absolutely get stuck on something , you are going to get moved on , so it kind of limits the frustration. Well built sets. Great fun and also replayable. 12/10.

we both can't wait to come back and try a different game the were very friendly and helpful also

reviews.text:
Very good wine tasting experience for NZD10 only and affordable bottles at NZD24. Tasting is waived if purchasing a bottle.
My favs were the Sauv Blanc and Syrah.
Owner Adam was really friendly.
Loved the Riesling!
A delightful cellar door
Thanks for the loan of the wine glasses! Wine was delicious !

Great wine in a very relaxed food market in the heart of the city. If you come to the Riverside Market in Christchurch, this is the place to enjoy a variety of wines, including awesome withes and velvety reds.

Saigon‚Äã‚Äç‚Äã‚Äå‚Äç‚Äã‚Äç‚Äå Star is definitely one of the places that you can get pho at its best in Christchurch, a delicious broth that is packed with flavor, fresh herbs, and noodles that are just right. The beef on the hot stone plate was probably the best thing there, very tender, packed with flavor, and it was even more flavorful because it was still smoking, and hence very hot, freshly served right at the table. Nice service, beautiful presentation, and inviting atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for authentic Vietnamese ‚Äã‚Äç‚Äã‚Äå‚Äç‚Äã‚Äç‚Äåflavors!

I ordered the hot stone beef pho and fresh spring rolls. The broth was rich and flavorful, so deep and intense that it almost made my lips stick togetherüòÇ but I really enjoyed it. However, the dish didn‚Äôt come with coriander or a slice of lemon on the side.
Good food! Noodle soup so yummy.i love it . I Will come back again!!üëç
Tasty lunch
The overall price is high, but their Vietnamese pho is very delicious, and fried chicken fillet is also worth recommending.

Saigon Star has been our go to for lunch & dinner for maybe 10-15yrs? The food is delicious, reasonably priced and service is quick. Staff become your friends pretty quick. Vege pho is the best. We're sad to be moving  ... can you buy a restaurant up north please!! We'll miss ya heaps & will pop in when we're in chc next.  Mike & Winnie

Want on a busy Saturday night, chose the chefs choice menu and so delighted we did. Lovely meal, with good sized portions and beautiful flavors that progressed through the menu. Delightful evening with lovely service, good cocktails and a cosy space.
Our first visit to Story and we will definitely be back. Wonderful friendly service. Cosy but comfortable setting. Food was next level delicious celebrating local and seasonal produce.

I had dinner here last Saturday and the food was excellent , as was the service we had the best waiter ever. He was terrific. I highly recommend this place
Really fresh sushi and sashimi, and quick service,  perfect for a quick, healthy lunch on the go. I wish they'd ditch the little soy sauce fish though - horrible waste of plastic.

This place has done amazing riceballs for years. Unfortunately today, found out they have gone the way of many chain sushi places - all rice and minimal chicken (for $8.50!). People are still lovely though.

Three of us for dinner before going to a concert in Lyttelton.
Booked for 6.30 and were seated by 6.35.
Drinks order taken promptly and served.
2 large pizzas and Spags chips ordered when drinks delivered.
About 30 minutes later the waitress asked if we wanted anything else. We reminded her of the 2 pizzas and chips. She had NOT placed our order with the kitchen. 5 min and the chips arrived. Another 10 - 15 minutes and we had our pizza.
This delay over shadowed the meal which was ok. Venison pieces were sparse and chewy. Chips were great but could be because we were getting quite hungry.
We ended up 20mins late for our 8pm concert.
Disappointing.

üçì: Every single dish absolutely blew us away. The price point is there for a reason, and I'd gladly pay double. The flavours worked so harmoniously with each other, complimented with wonderful cocktails as well.

üçú A bowl of noodle soup I‚Äôve eaten for 30 years ‚Äî my Cambodian soul food üá∞üá≠

I‚Äôve eaten this same bowl of noodle soup for 30 years.
And every bite feels like traveling back in time.
Within that familiar flavor lies a different memory each time.

After school as a kid, I‚Äôd bike past this little noodle shop.
In high school, I‚Äôd sneak out at lunch for a bowl of Cambodian kuy teav.
Even after long shifts at work, I‚Äôd still find my way back for a hot bowl.
Everyone has that one noodle soup they call their own.
For me, this isn‚Äôt just lunch or dinner, and definitely not just street food ‚Äî
It‚Äôs a taste of home, and a timeline of my life.

The broth is made from chicken bones simmered all day ‚Äî rich, yet clean.
The rice noodles are silky, the beef slices cooked just right,
Finished with a spoon of that signature tangy chili sauce ‚Äî
Each bite is familiar, each sip carries me back to childhood.

It‚Äôs been 30 years.
The stall has changed, the owner too.
But this bowl of soup, this flavor ‚Äî never did.

‚Äî

#CambodiaBeefNoodleSoup #TasteOfHome #30YearsOfNoodles
#KuyTeav #CambodianStreetFood #NostalgicFlavors
#MySoulFood #FoodWithMemory #ComfortInABowl

DTA is a relatively new restaurant offering both eat-in and take out. It is the in-house restaurant at the Grand Riccarton Hotel, so is not immediately obvious. As an in-house restaurant the decor is toned down, but pleasant. The staff are both friendly and attentive. The menu choice is smaller than you might expect at an Indian restaurant, but the food was well cooked, being very well spiced and delicious. I had Paneer Padkora entree, which is made using their own made Paneer. It was my first try of tbis dish and I wasnt disappointed. For main I had Chicken Kadhi (hot) with plain rice and Naan. The main was beautifully spiced with great balance and very tasty. The rice portion was spot on, enough to enjoy with the main, leaving enough gravy to mop up using the Naan. It was a great meal, and I would definitely go again.

We hosted our annual team dinner at DTA (Don't Tell Anyone) and the experience was fantastic. The private room provided the perfect environment for a productive yet relaxed evening, and the staff were incredibly professional, ensuring every detail was covered with a friendly demeanor. The food was excellent across the board, handling various dietary needs with ease, and multiple colleagues commented on the high quality of the dishes. For any business looking for a reliable, high-end venue for a corporate function, DTA is a stellar choice we will definitely be using again.

We had a fantastic time for our business conference dinner! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming ‚Äî perfect for great food and even better conversation. The staff were friendly and organized, making everything run smoothly. Every dish was delicious, from the starters to dessert. It was the perfect spot to unwind after a busy day of meetings. Highly recommend for any team or corporate event!

The name says ‚ÄúDNT Tell Anyone (DTA)‚Äù, but I honestly want to tell everyone! üòÑ The food here is absolutely amazing ‚Äî authentic Indian flavours, perfectly balanced spices, and the consistency is always spot on. Every dish tastes fresh, rich, and made with love.

It‚Äôs rare to find a place that delivers true Indian taste every single time ‚Äî DTA definitely sets a new standard! Highly recommend this hidden gem

I‚Äôve been eating at Shanghai Bistro for years with my family, I‚Äôve even come for my brother‚Äôs graduation celebration and I‚Äôve always loved their food and service. The other night I came with my friends, and one of us had dietary requirements which I made it clear to the waitress during ordering - she was Muslim. I spoke in Mandarin Chinese so there‚Äôs no way she heard me incorrectly. Since we didn‚Äôt want to risk meat, we ordered from the ‚ÄúVegetables‚Äù section on the ordering IPad. Now, I‚Äôve never personally ordered from this tab because my family are meat lovers so I thought these were all completely vegeterian dishes. On the IPad ordering system there‚Äôs also nothing indicating what has meat and what doesn‚Äôt. Now I understand that the waitress probably thought the eggplants were for the rest who wasn‚Äôt Muslim so she didn‚Äôt say anything but I don‚Äôt understand why a dish with meat would be in the vegetable section. They should make it that more clear with labels on every dish on what‚Äôs vegeterian and what isn‚Äôt for any future vegetarians/vegans/muslims. However, I do have to say that the waitress did do a nice job defusing the situation, she allowed us to order another dish and this time walked us through what‚Äôs ACTUALLY vegetarian in the vegetable section and changed my friend‚Äôs rice, plates, cutleries, etc. We also had no issues with their other dishes. But again, I‚Äôd advise all vegetarians/vegans/muslims to be careful while ordering and understand that their ‚Äúvegetable‚Äù section isn‚Äôt vegetarian until they change that, or just go to a different Chinese restaurant to be safe. :)

Just discovered this humble ramen spot ‚Äî Soshite Hikari, and it‚Äôs quickly become my go-to budget-friendly comfort food place, especially during the start (and end!) of the month. They specialize in affordable, clean-tasting, and light ramen, and even have $10 lunch specials on weekdays!

‚∏ª

üëõ Transparent Pricing, Super Wallet-Friendly
‚Ä¢	Signature ramen is only $12.8 ‚Äî easily one of the most affordable bowls in Christchurch
‚Ä¢	$10 weekday lunch specials with great variety ‚Äî and no, they‚Äôre not just filler dishes!

üçú Light Broth, Springy Noodles
I ordered the seafood ramen, and the broth was unexpectedly light and non-greasy. It‚Äôs that kind of clean, refreshing soup that won‚Äôt leave you thirsty afterward. The noodles were perfectly cooked with a nice bounce, and the toppings included fresh shrimp, half a marinated egg, greens, and wakame seaweed. Great value for the price!

üíß No free noodles, but free soup refills!
If you‚Äôre a broth lover like me, this is a huge plus. The free soup refill makes the whole meal feel extra satisfying and cozy.

üç± The $10 Lunch Specials Are a Hidden Gem
Their rice bowl lunch sets are just $10 and perfect for a quick and filling midday meal. The portion is decent too ‚Äî definitely enough to keep you going through the afternoon.

üì¶ Their takeaway packaging is adorable!
The ramen comes in a pull-tab container that looks like a drink can. Super cute, totally Instagram-worthy, and still keeps the soup hot ‚Äî love that fun detail!

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Who I‚Äôd Recommend This To:
‚Ä¢	Anyone who loves ramen but prefers it on the lighter, less salty side
‚Ä¢	Students or office workers looking for a solid meal without breaking the bank
‚Ä¢	People who enjoy clean, simple flavors and unique presentation styles

‚∏ª

Verdict:
Soshite Hikari doesn‚Äôt go for flashy gimmicks, but wins your heart with honest pricing and gentle, satisfying broth. Whether you‚Äôre a local or a traveler on a budget, this spot is definitely worth checking out!
Loved all of this experience. The service was amazing-everyone helping to take care of all tables. Vegan menu to go along with the regular menu.

Lovely food and service. Will definitely be back.

üåü 5Star Vietnamese ‚Äì Truly Lives Up to Its Name! üáªüá≥

Tried out 5Star Vietnamese recently and was genuinely impressed by both the flavor and presentation.

ü•¢ Fresh Spring Rolls ‚Äì Light, crisp, and packed with herbs, prawns, and vermicelli. The peanut dipping sauce on the side was rich and creamy, perfectly tying it all together. A great way to start the meal!

üçú 5-Star Fried Vermicelli ‚Äì This dish was a standout! Smoky wok-fried vermicelli, topped with crispy shallots, lemongrass chicken, and just the right hint of spice. It had that perfect balance of texture‚Äîcrispy edges with soft noodles underneath.

üçö 5-Star Special Broken Rice ‚Äì A total flavour bomb. The grilled pork chop was juicy and marinated to perfection, paired with a crispy spring roll, shredded pork skin, and a soft egg. The rice was fragrant and fluffy, and the fish sauce drizzle brought everything together.

Service was friendly, food came out fast, and the portions were generous. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre after authentic, satisfying Vietnamese in town.

We love this place & it has quickly become a favourite stop of ours to visit each week. A friend introduced me to buying their riggers of beer online for collection during lockdown & I fell for their hoppy Red Rye IPA, Anchor Me Hazy Pale Ale, California Dreaming malty steam ale & now their spot on Yorkshire Bitter or ESB. My partner enjoys the best Pilsner in NZ, the lighter Kolsch, Uprising blonde ale & particularly the unusual turmeric flavoured pilsner... Oh and some tasty guest beers or several tantalising gins from across NZ!

We loved it so much that we held our wedding reception here! Now it's great roomy beer shed has become the favourite regular haunt for us, accompanied by some cool live bands,  musical playlists & tasty in-house food. With welcoming & considerate bar staff to polish off the experience & a cosy log fire for those cold nights, we look forward to going there every time, without fail... that said, there's always Two Thumb on Colombo as a trendy alternative.

I ordered dinner from Curry Deluxe for delivery last night and spent over $100 on my Uber Eats order, but it was absolutely worth every dollar. I ordered several different curries for my family, and each one was a masterpiece. The butter chicken was creamy and rich, the lamb rogan josh was tender and full of flavour, and the vindaloo had the perfect amount of heat. Everything was packaged perfectly and arrived hot, which isn't always the case with delivery. The generous portions and incredible taste made the price feel justified. This is hands-down the best Indian takeaway in Christchurch, and I'll definitely be ordering from them again

The flavors are incredible, and the portions are generous. Their delivery service is prompt, and the staff is always so friendly when I call to place an order. It's so nice to get five-star quality Indian food delivered right to my door. I highly recommend them if you're looking for a top-notch takeaway experience.

reviews.text: We stopped by and found out that reservations are required for all dining in, but luckily they kindly accommodated us. The food was generous in portion and absolutely delicious. The pad see eew were among the best I‚Äôve had in Christchurch, and the crispy pork truly lived up to its name. Next time, we‚Äôll make a booking in advance.

The food is consistently great and full of flavour, also it‚Äôs made with some high-quality ingredients, and the portions are generous. The staff are also very attentive and friendly. I have been a customer to adipoli since few years. I always felt the price is really high comparing the competitors.

When ordering single briyani, they always push pepsi and get 18 dollars. I don't want pepsi, I asked the same to the person and he refused to remove the pepsi and told me it will cost the same despite don't wanting pepsi.

This cheap method of pushing stuffs to customers and with high profit margins is not fair.
Also, day by day the quantity keeps reducing. I request you keep you standard at least.
Not usually a fan of biriyani, but the one from here was surprisingly good. Definitely worth a try!

Chef Alex & Campbell in the front of house teamed up to deliver one of the best experiences in my month-long visit from San Francisco. Gatherings is in what appears to be an emerging culinary hot spot at the corner of Victoria & Bealey, an easy 25‚Äô walk or quick Uber ride from the CBD, & the just-picked produce (asparagus & radish/lettuce salad) & perfectly executed mains (crumbed Poaka pork chop w/ a wonderful mustard butter sauce) & dessert (cr√®me caramel taken to the next level with a crispy clove/lemon biscuit) made for a terrific value, reminiscent of Delfina or State Bird in SF. Hope to be back on a future visit, after they‚Äôve grabbed a star to match their hat :-)

My local spot, and probably the only one I visit regularly.

Seasonal dishes, cozy atmosphere, good wines by the glasses/bottles.  Using fresh, local ingredients that are in season.

A beautiful boutique resturant. The food was exceptionally great all seasonal fresh and beautifully plated. Had a great Negroni and a lovely bottle of Wine. The service was warm and knowledgeable. She was knowledgeable and her suggestions were right on. Great great place
Food was interesting and creative, the front door opens in (it‚Äôll make sense), we chose the feed us option and enjoyed it.
Absolutely beautiful. The perfect combination of exquisite, considered, and inspired flavours in a warm, understated and classy atmosphere.
Such amazing food, decour and service, best restaurant in Christchurch üëå

Had a great experience here yesterday. Went in for the lunch cocktail club with some friends. Great drinks, great food. Would have a loved a little more on the antipasto platter however all the food was delicious. Very accommodating to my friend who wanted mocktails and who arrived slightly late and they brought her out her own mini antipasto platter since she missed out on the main one.
Highly recommend.
Wonderful food, if you don't mind waiting for no apparent reason .
The food was delicious, i had travelled from Australia, the place had a great vie
Great food, great service.

The Sottilette rolled pizza base with napoli sauce, Wairiri buffalo burrata and fresh basil was tasty and delicious.

The NZ Southern Stations wagyu was cooked to medium to medium well instead of the medium rare I asked for, and was a little under seasoned. But it did have a nice chargrilled sear. The black garlic pur√©e tasted burnt and the texture was very grainy. For $45 dollars, the dish felt incomplete.

The Pappardelle al rag√π di cervo, braised venison rag√π with juniper and thyme,
finished with berries and cr√®me fra√Æche looked amazing and the fruit gave the rich sauce some welcome, acidic respite. Unfortunately the pasta and the sauce were severely lacking seasoning.

It was interesting that the restaurant styles itself as an Italian inspired eatery but there was no Italian wine on offer. Not to worry though, as the Mt Difficulty Pinot Noir was a fine accompaniment to all the dishes.

Where things really went off the rails was the level of service we received or didn't receive. When our starter was finished, our plates and cutlery were not cleared before the main came out out. There was no cutlery for the main at all, including the rather essential steak knife. We had to approach the bar staff in order to find some wait staff to then get us what we needed to eat our dishes.

The server who attended to us was very apologetic and rectified the issue straight away, and even asked us if we'd like more drinks or desserts --- something we had yet to be asked by the other staff who had previously attended us.

When it was time to pay, the front of house staff member who collected the bill did not think to ask how we found the meal and we left rather disappointed overall.
Good atmosphere with pleasant, helpful staff. Great food
Beef
Sophie and Emily made my morning with their excellent service! Best coffee in town

Sadly noodles were overcooked and doughy.
Meat portion in beef noodle soup was sparse.
As for the bun with the filling, the bun was unfortunately very solid and hard to chew through. :( looked like a young family starting a new business so would like to come back to support but there needs to be improvement.

This place is the postman....it delivers everytime.

Best cold noodles in the South Island.
Great food üëç
Great food, huge portions, affordable price and friendly staff! Very clean and tidy! Highly recommend üëå

Excellent,  we thoroughly enjoyed, will definitely be back, meat cooked to perfection, I would order more salads/veges to go with it next time to balance out the meats,  we tried quite a few meat dishes and were even given a freebie! we were very full ! Loved the Yuzu lemon RTD drink!

It's very busy (popular)we booked and the waitress suggested to order some karrageen chicken which is quick to come out which served as a good starter.

No room for dessert unfortunately!

TY

Our favourite place but so seriously disappointed with the food last night. & we had a guest from USA.. salmon skewers - really undercooked & too much sauce on top , prawns seriously overcooked & dry. Lamb skewers - meat was so stringy & way too salty again. Scallops were great. Service great but meal was so wanting ..

Sorry but this was one of the poorest quality meals we‚Äôve ever had at yours & such a disappointment - we were at the early 5.30 pm dinner service.
Very good wangu beef and Salmon sashimi.Beautiful deco with green plants.
Delicious food all round but the star was the Salmon Nigigri and Karaage chicken! Will definitely be back very soon!

Wonderful experience, sat at high table in front of grills, chef was very knowledgeable added to the experience, food excellent would be nice to see shiitake mushrooms instead of brown mushrooms, sadly missed out on the fish collar only salmon left, perhaps next time. Reasonably priced
Service was exceptional and food was delicious, definitely will return.

We visit Bar Yoku every time we‚Äôre in Christchurch and it never disappoints! The atmosphere and vibe are always great, and the staff are super friendly and attentive. The food is incredible -highlights for us were the beef tataki, wagyu beef sushi taco, and the kingfish skirt. One of our absolute favourite spots in the city!
Menu was very good but to much. Portion are to big. We are not able to eat all of it

I really love all of them!
We can enjoy Japanese taste!
A hidden gem. Fresh and delicious, fast sushi takeaways or soul-warming main entrees.

Oh my goodness! This hidden gem of a Japanese eatery is an ideal spot for a lunchtime visit. They craft various delightful Dons that are not only visually stunning but also bursting with delicious flavors. Each dish is freshly prepared and elegantly presented in distinctive bowls, providing a rich cultural and culinary experience.
I can't fault the sushi. One of the best in town.

restaurant: Roti Chai Indian Street Kitchen Halswell

reviews.text:
First time visit last Thursday, this place was recommended by family member. Restaurant front is inviting and interior has a cool layout; person who took our order was welcoming. My nephew and I ordered the lunch special to go, comes with choice of curry and comes with rice and Naan bread. He got mild butter chicken and I got hot lamb Rogan Josh. Both consumed within minutes as soon as got home. The spice of my Rogan Josh was expectedly hot, wishing it could go hotter. Naan was hot and fresh. Will come again for sure.
Edit: visited here again last weekend (Sat 1st Nov 2025) and the food was just as exceptional. Instead of takeaway we dined in this time round; ordered entrees onion bhaji and samosas with complimentary sauces, they were filling and tasty, with just right level of spice. Mains were lamb korma and lamb Rogan Josh, both spicy and delicious. Service was attentive and excellent, can't recommend this place enough. Six stars
Delicious food. Amazing customer service.

Had a wonderful dining experience at Roti Chai in Halswell! The food was absolutely delightful ‚Äî the chicken biryani was packed with flavour, and the palak paneer was fresh, creamy, and perfectly spiced. The restaurant had a warm and welcoming atmosphere that made us feel comfortable right away. Highly recommend Roti Chai for anyone craving authentic Indian food and sincere hospitality. Five stars all the way! üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

It was my first time ordering food from rotichai.i have ordered chicken buna and some naan.....üòäit was so yummy and still i can feel the flavour and aroma.They have the good presentation tooo ....  Great customer service too.We loved it üòª Highly recommended place‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

We have ordered from here a few times and it has been good tonight something was off the butter chicken tasted off and smelt like off bacon it was not nice at all my whole family could not finish there plate at all.

Beautiful little restaurant and very friendly staff. Food was perfect, just the right amount of spice for a guy who doesnt like his food too hot. I could taste all of the flavors but still had a little bit of heat to enhance the experience. Highly recommend coming here.
Really nice food - tried something different with the Lamb Palak and no regrets. Good sized portions, great service - will be back!

Such an awesome place with great vibes great food and amazing atmosphere, loved their pasta so much and the Italian beer, portions were so big for the price (in a good way) definitely reccomend this place!

This is not the first time we went. The food is bigger portion compared to our previous visit which was last year. Our waitress is friendly and knowledgeable. We like the atmosphere as not too noisy though most tables were occupied.

I love the Caesar salad however it is very inconsistent- I guess, depending which chef is on. Sometimes they forget the egg, sometimes there are no anchovies, hardly any bacon or heaps of bacon and plain unseasoned croutons and very little lettuce.
I made a point of asking this be rectified on ordering the salad for my 8th time in the past year, my request was met with extreme arrogance.
A simple request and as a chef you should take pride in serving consistently excellent food to people who are paying good money and have reasonable expectations of what quality food is.
Great overall, just a bit pricy
A group of 7 of us ordered 4 dishes with rice when we were 1/2 hour‚Äôs drive out of Christchurch. The food was ready and hot and well packaged when we arrived for our ‚ÄòTakeaway‚Äô
Love to visit Hungry thaiger lovely service with various option available as we had some   Honey lemon chicken and beef cheek massaman curry really delicious, Highly recommend this place
Ordered off Uber. Food was delicious, Lots of veggie and meat. Great flavour ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòä
Had a takeaway order. It was Beautiful!!!  Best Thai food I‚Äôve had. Every mouthful was delicious. Will definitely go back when over in Chch next.
ordered off uber eats and honestly it was so delicious!!! so much flavour and good portions! really enjoyed our dinner and even eating some leftovers for lunch today!
Absolutely delicious! And safe for a sensitive coeliac. I have order a few times now from door dash. Highly rate the Beef cheek massaman curry and Bangkok Cashew Nut. Yum!

If you're craving authentic Indian flavours in Christchurch, Saffron Spice in Hornby is the place I keep coming back to,and for good reason.

From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with the comforting aroma of spices and a team that treats you like family. The ambience is relaxed yet vibrant, perfect for a casual dinner or a celebratory feast.

What sets Saffron Spice apart? Consistency. Their biryani is a personal favourite,fragrant, generous, and packed with flavour. And if you're into heat, the vindaloo delivers a satisfying kick without overpowering the dish.

Service is always prompt and friendly, with staff happy to guide you through the menu or tweak spice levels to suit your taste. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you feel looked after, not just served.

Whether I‚Äôm grabbing a quick takeaway or settling in for a slow meal with friends, Saffron Spice never disappoints. It‚Äôs my go-to spot in Hornby when I want food that‚Äôs bold, comforting, and unmistakably Indian.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with their chicken biryani üòã. The family pack is definitely the best option ‚Äî it easily serves at least 8 people! Kadai and tandoori chicken is highly recommended as well.
Delicious food and service

been to this restaurant many times - multiple name and ownership changes over time. Masala Dosa has always been my favourite there - having been recommended it to me as 'the best in Christchurch'. Very disappointing this time. Filling mainly consisted of onions. When pointing this out and questioning the change of recipe the response just was: 'maybe a different chef since last time'. The naan the worst I have had as well. Won't be back

Best Indian in Christchurch hands down! Have tried plenty of other Indian restaurants and none even come close to this one. The food is always so consistently good and flavours are amazing. The chicken posht is a highlight plus the naan breads are divine especially the jalape√±o and cheese!. The service is always 10/10. Would highly recommend!

I have been here twice in this week... Tuesday I dropped in super hungry after shopping with my daughter.... First things first.... welcoming smiling faces, then the menu came with recommendations, then came the plates... the plates were HOT... my dad always said that that was the sign of a good restaurant!!! And true to that,  the food was fingerlicking good... had goa prawns and garlic Naan on Tuesday and mutton rogangosh, butter prawns and garlic Naan....
Overall 10/10
Kimbap, jjamppong, jjajang, sweet and sour pork
The kimbap is so good, the noodles are tasty, and the service is friendly.
It's OK but not great. Average Korean Chinese restaurant.

If you're in Christchurch and craving authentic Korean food, this restaurant is a must-try. The Korean black bean noodles (jjajangmyeon) are hands down the highlight‚Äîrich, savory, and perfectly cooked. Every dish I've tried here has been delicious, with fresh ingredients and fantastic flavors. The service is friendly, and the atmosphere is welcoming, making it a great spot for any occasion. Highly recommend checking it out!

We recently had catering from Aroma Delight for an event, and the food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì fresh, flavorful, and enjoyed by everyone. A special shoutout to Prince, who arranged everything for us. He was extremely nice, humble, and made the whole process stress-free. Highly recommend their service and food!

Hyderabad chicken biriyani is entirely different, first time I am getting green coloured chicken in Hyderabad chicken biriyani was so bad.

We had the same dish before couple of months and it was good. But the food we had yesterday was not good.

I hope you will learn to make Hyderabad chicken biriyani in future or else remove Hyderabad chicken biriyani name from your menu and just add chicken biriyani and improve quality

Perfect start before court theatre.

Went for pre drink tonight before going to Issac theatre.  I have never been so rudely treated by a barman anywhere in world.  Absolute disgrace.  His level of disinterest was staggering.  After several exchanges re drinks order  I decided I had had enough and told him to forget it as his attitude sucked snd walked out.  Whoever is running this place get better staff.  Disgraceful.
Wonderful staff create a relaxed atmosphere perfect for a quiet night... conversation, cheese and whisky!
Came to try flights of NZ whiskey only to find it‚Äôs not offered weekends. Old fashion is decent.

This bar was decorated really nicely with nice velvet couches, board games and a fireplace. They have a few mixed drink options, we both got martinis. Otherwise they have a lot of whisky. We did ask for other suggestions of drinks but it seemed like we had to stick to the few on the menu. The jam on the martini was really good and a unique garnish!

I walked in the restaurant, and waiting in front of the counter ask the staff I want to order takeaways, they looked too busy to go to the counter. After a while, a staff went up to the counter (maybe record the order or something), I wait until she finished and ready to take my order,  but just after I order the first dish, she likes remembering something and said, ‚Äúwait a minute, I‚Äôm going to give the cutlery to the customer first and I‚Äôll come back‚Äù after she said that, I was kind of confused since I was in the middle of taking my order and the cutlery is not necessary to be served immediately when nothing on the table of the customers she mentioned. She took a bit long time and slowly back to the counter to wash her hands (I wonder how dirty the cutlery she just served are). We had an excellent and truly memorable dining experience here last 26th of August. From the moment we walked in, the cozy and romantic ambience set the perfect mood for our anniversary dinner.

Our server, Riley, went above and beyond, he was friendly, warm, and thoughtful. He made sure we had everything we needed without us ever having to ask, and even served us with a special anniversary dessert, which made the night extra special.

The food was outstanding, steak was a perfect 5/5, cooked beautifully and packed with flavor. The pork dish was also delicious, around 4/5, but still very enjoyable.

Overall, it was a night to remember, thanks to the wonderful service, great food, and intimate atmosphere. We would definitely come back again.

The best food I have eaten in my whole life! Delicious.
The tastiest Chinese food in christchurch!! The sour wonton soup and the fungus salad are delicious, and really great portions. Highly recommend this restaurant <3

I visited for dinner on Sunday night and ordered the spiced edamame and signature miso ramen, both of which were good as always. However, the service was dissapointing. Despite the restaurant not being particularly busy, I had a long wait. I was seated upstairs and had to wait 20 minutes for someone to take my order, at which point I had to get up and go to the counter myself. The male kiwi waiter seemed distracted by his phone and didn't seem to notice the dirty tables around me. After I got my food, I had to ask for cutlery, which took another 10-15 minutes to arrive. It was a bit frustrating, especially given how empty the restaurant was.
Osso buco was v. tender & yummy.

We had a great girls night at Delilah. There was live music when we arrived which was lovely. Can't really comment on the food as we only had nibbles (crispy chicken and chips) which were good. Their cocktails are yummy (we had the hey there delilah). The atmosphere it was really busy so it was really loud and hard to have a conversation as couldn't hear much. Service was good, the lady serving us was very friendly and accomodating. ‚ù§Ô∏è

The food was lovely, we went specifically to hear the live music and have a few nibbles with our drinks.  I am very critical when it comes to squid and what arrived on my plate was cooked to perfection.  I loved the live music supplied by the Jinx Duo, the atmosphere they created was fun and good easy listening.

The bread that we ordered seems very heavy and very oily as if it was soaked in oil for a long time, a but bland too. That server named Daisy is also SOOOOO RUDE. I was talking to her to order but she literally just walked pass me. It wasn‚Äôt even a busy night yet because you can see her not doing anything at the corner.

The server named Daisy (i think thats her name) is very rude! went there on halloween night. She looks very uninterested on serving us then go at the back and dance with her other coworker. The other servers are nice but her. She looks older than the other server because shes taller than all of them. Just hope shes not the manager because thats just not it.

Service today was pretty poor!
We were told to take a seat and someone would be out with menus.... despite a few staff members coming out to serve the 3 or 4 other tables outside without noticing or caring that we were sat with an empty table, that didnt happen so we ended up using the QR code on the table after 20 mins passed (I was actually ready to leave). To be fair, if we were told or asked to us the QR code from the start we would've been happy to do so.
3/4 of our drinks arrived, the next arrived several mins after that.
The food we ordered was actually really good (and the waitress that bought it out was very pleasant).
I don't know why no one bothered to serve us today, I have enjoyed coming here in the past but today missed the mark completely when it comes to service. There are plenty of other choices in the area, lots of competition, wouldn't you want to show up for your customers as best you possibly can.

Nice restaurant with friendly staff and nice food. I didnt give it 5 stars because I felt the market fish was a little bland but otherwise tender. The steak was nice. My highlight was the chicken salad I thought the flavours worked well.

Super impressed with our meal at Indian Vibes tonight. The samosas, pakoras, lamb korma and butter chicken were ELITE! The butter chicken wasn‚Äôt too sweet and the meat was tender. The lamb korma was just so flavourful. We were thoroughly looked after by the very kind gentleman who served us and who anticipated our every need. And the meal was very reasonable, price wise. Thank you to you both - an excellent experience all round!
Goat Nawabi was incredible. tender, rich, and full of flavour. Indian Vibes nailed it!
Great food great service

Friendly staff and good food. Good vibes, just like it says on the sign.

Probably your new local.
great food and friendly service. Excellent local takeaways
