Lovely find in downtown Christchurch. I had a chicken breast crumbed and dressed in apple slices and a lovely light sauce. My friend had a pasta ragout. Service was friendly and fast. Staff were attentive and very courteous. Would definitely go again on my next visit to Christchurch.

We had a fantastic meal at Bar Franco, would absolutely recommend it. Everything we ate was amazing, the drinks were good, the wait staff provided great recommendations of dishes to try and wine to go with it, the service was outstanding, and it was a great atmosphere.
We had a wonderful experience at Bar Franco. Delicious food and extremely helpful and friendly staff, what more could you want!
Great option for a dinner catch up with the girls

Fab service through the evening! Great Italian food as the menu is different than other Italian restaurant - so it‚Äôs worth for Italian food lover to try Bar Franco‚Äôs cuisine üòÄ - Love the open kitchen style too.
Handsome Cashier and very social, made me wanna buy more hehe

Really really good butter chicken $18.50 and Chana Masala $14.50. The guy who served us was super nice. The website is also really nice and intuitive with a good menu.
Unreal service
Some of the best food we have had. Have catered couple of times from then and the food is amazing...thank you guys for the great food. 100% recommend
Great tasting food and pleasant service, all at a good price - as always. Well done team.
Chinese food enak di new zealand christchurch

I have been a regular since a decade ago. It‚Äôs definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants in NZ. My favourite dishes here are: black pepper beef, egg tofu and their duck dishes. Not cheap but they are just consistent and delightful.

Absolutely delicious.  All their dishes are yummy. We make a point of going there whenever in ChCh.

The third time visit today as in town and not many places were open on the public holiday. Definitely not as good as the first visit which was back in Dec. The fish was good with generous spices at that time. So went back had screwers in pot, didn‚Äôt like it as it was quite pale, ingredients weren‚Äôt really quality, this was back in Feb. The young girl serving on Saturday afternoon seemed rude and uninterested. She was on her phone, had a frown on her face, and didn‚Äôt pay much attention when we asked questions. That said, the drink itself was actually really good.
Younger girl who served us on Saturday afternoon was hostile and Cole and barley a said a word. On her phone inattentive and gave attitude when asked a question. Drinks were good.

We sat here because we saw a lot of people. Cocktails were bad. Ice in the aperol was almost melted, so it was barrely chilled. I recently visited Tony‚Äôs Teppanyaki in Ferrymead, Christchurch, and I was extremely disappointed. The restaurant advertises itself as an all-you-can-eat experience, but it felt like a SCAM.
The price had recently changed without any notice, and it wasn‚Äôt mentioned when we arrived. We were seated from 5:30 pm to about 7:10 pm and only received about one and a half rounds of food. When we asked for more, the service was painfully slow.
There were only four staff members: two chefs cooking, one chef running around, and one lady handling drinks and seating. With just five tables occupied, there‚Äôs no reason the service should have been that poor.
On top of that, the portions were smaller compared to Tony‚Äôs in Riccarton, and the whole experience was frustrating. If you claim to be all-you-can-eat, you should actually deliver that not make customers wait ages for minimal food.
Overall, this felt misleading and disappointing. I would not recommend the Ferrymead location at all.

We went to this place for spicy food. I will say, it isn‚Äôt too spicy but the flavour is there. There is chilli oil if you need to put more spice in.

We got the sliced beef in tongue numbing sauce and the pork dumplings in Sichuan style sauce. The dumplings were soft and flavourful, the pork‚Äôs natural oil coated my lips nicely. The sliced beef was the standard velveted beef, the kicker is the sauce. Make sure to have Jasmine rice on the side to soak up all the flavour. They were very generous with the serving, three people could be full with the sliced beef.

The atmosphere was eccentric, kids would definitely have a blast looking at the paper statues of minecraft characters, a gigantic ice age character with his wallnut, and Chinese decorations. Despite its unusual decor, the temperature and the overall atmosphere makes you feel very at peace while eating and conversing with your loved ones.

I cannot stop talking about how the table and chair are the perfect height in relation to each other, it just makes you feel extra comfortable in the space.

I would highly recommend eating in, the service was very accommodating. They asked for my preference for forks or chopsticks, hot water, and if I needed more spice.

Overall, this place does well in what it does. 5/5.

Edit: We came back again, it was the best fried rice we have ever tasted. I thought it would be the usual fried rice from Chinese takeaways, but this one was different. It was not oily, the wok hei is to die for. They made it spicy just for us because we seem to have ordered only spicy food off the menu, which was nice. The wontons were so soft and tender. The intestine noodle soup was way more flavourful than our usual noodle spot in Riccarton. It definitely satisfied our spicy cravings. The front of house person is always accommodating, a stark contrast to some restaurants around the city.

We went back for a third time, but didn't realise they are closed on Wednesdays.

If you‚Äôre like me, sometimes all you want for lunch is a hot plate of rice with a few hearty, familiar dishes. I found just that at a humble Chinese restaurant in Christchurch ‚Äî and the best part? It was only $10.

Here‚Äôs what I had today:
‚Ä¢	üî• Mapo Tofu ‚Äì Silky soft tofu with a light kick of spice and that signature numbing flavor. Not too oily, super comforting, and perfect with rice.
‚Ä¢	ü•¨ Stir-fried Celery with Pork ‚Äì Crisp celery and tender pork slices cooked simply but full of wok hei ‚Äî tasted just like home cooking.
‚Ä¢	ü•î Braised Beef Brisket with Potato ‚Äì The beef was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the potato soaked up all that rich, savory sauce. It honestly felt like something that had been simmering for hours in a family kitchen.

üçö Served with a generous portion of steamed white rice, the whole meal felt hearty, warm, and deeply satisfying. No frills, just honest-to-goodness food that reminds you of a meal back home.

üìç If you‚Äôre in Christchurch and craving a real Chinese lunch that doesn‚Äôt break the bank, this spot is a hidden gem. The dishes change daily too ‚Äî so there‚Äôs always something new to try.

A memorable and mouthwatering experience at Rangoon Ruby

I had the pleasure of dining at Rangoon Ruby on Colombo Street in Christchurch, thanks to a thoughtful recommendation‚Äîand invitation‚Äîfrom a friend originally from Burma. What a delightful discovery.

The restaurant‚Äôs interior is simply stunning. Modern touches blend seamlessly with traditional Burmese details‚Äîfrom the intricately designed menu on the wall and the colorful umbrellas adorning the ceiling, to the striking mural of Burmese women gracing the back wall. It creates a welcoming and culturally rich atmosphere.

From the moment we stepped inside, the hospitality was exceptional. The hostess greeted us with genuine warmth, and we were pleasantly surprised when the Chef and members of the kitchen staff came out to say hello. Our waiter was equally impressive‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu.

Now, the food. Every dish was a standout. The seafood was perfectly cooked, infused with delicate yet vibrant flavours. The beef curry was melt-in-your-mouth tender, no knife required. I couldn‚Äôt get enough of the Tea Leaf Salad‚ÄîI nearly finished the entire thing myself. We ended on a high note with a dessert that tasted like a comforting blend of warm rice pudding and sponge cake, paired with fresh fruit and cream.

All in all, Rangoon Ruby offers a truly special dining experience‚Äîflavourful, heartfelt, and beautifully executed. It‚Äôs an absolute must-try.
Absolutely love this place, the flavours in the food is just incredible!

Just discovered this hidden gem in Riccarton, Christchurch ‚Äî a Chinese takeaway spot offering a 4-dish combo for only $15. It works like the food court classic Hungry Wok, but the flavours are way more authentic and tailored for Chinese tastes.

üçõ Tons of options to choose from, freshly cooked and steaming hot. From what I saw (and tasted!):
‚Ä¢	Spicy chicken, tomato-braised chicken, mapo tofu
‚Ä¢	Stir-fried black fungus and cabbage, saut√©ed shredded potatoes, dry-fried green beans
‚Ä¢	Soy-braised eggplant, Chinese-style scrambled eggs, twice-cooked pork, home-style pork stew‚Ä¶

üçö You choose one base (white rice, fried rice, or fried noodles) and three hot dishes, all served fast and generously. The flavours are bold and savoury ‚Äî not overly sweet like Westernised Asian food ‚Äî perfect for a real Chinese meal.

üí¨ Staff speaks Mandarin, super friendly and quick service. Perfect for students, workers, or anyone who wants a filling, flavourful lunch or dinner.

üõçÔ∏è Located right near Riccarton‚Äôs shopping area, so you can grab a hot meal before or after errands. Takeaway boxes are sturdy and packed to the brim. Great value, authentic taste, and fast service ‚Äî what more do you need?

Barefoot Eatery (≈åtautahi) ‚Äì Review by Zee Tana

Visited: Friday morning, 10:30am
Dined with: My partner
Occasion: First-time visit, curious to try a fully vegan spot

‚∏ª

We decided to try Barefoot Eatery in central ≈åtautahi for a relaxed Friday morning breakfast. As a vegan-friendly establishment with a strong online reputation, we had decent hopes ‚Äî especially for a plant based-aligned offering. Unfortunately, while the caf√© looked good on the surface, the experience didn‚Äôt quite live up to the visuals.

First Impressions

The location is central and easy to get to. The space is light, open, and inviting, with an earthy, conscious vibe. However, it was immediately clear that the place was understaffed ‚Äî just one staff member running front-of-house during a busy Matariki morning crowd. They were doing their best, but the service naturally suffered because of it.

Service

Friendly but understandably stretched thin. No formal welcome, no check-in at the table, and minimal interaction beyond the counter. With only one person juggling coffee orders, seating, and food delivery, there was little opportunity for engagement or support. For what we paid, we hoped for more than just transactional.

Food & Drink

We ordered:
‚Ä¢	2x Big Vegan Breakfasts
‚Ä¢	1 Soy Latte
‚Ä¢	1 Long Black / Americano

Let‚Äôs start with the highlight: the coffee was excellent ‚Äî easily the best part of the morning. Smooth, strong, well-balanced, and perfectly made. That alone almost made up for the kai‚Ä¶ but not quite.

The Big Vegan Breakfasts looked amazing when they landed at the table ‚Äî visually, they were vibrant and beautifully plated. But the flavour didn‚Äôt match the appearance:
‚Ä¢	The scrambled tofu was watery and overpowered by the crispy chilli oil ‚Äî lacking the depth we expected from black salt or seasoning.
‚Ä¢	The mushrooms (only four small slices, and shrivelled) felt like an afterthought.
‚Ä¢	The sausages were small and bland.
‚Ä¢	No butter or spread on the bread, and no salt or pepper available to help adjust the flavour.
‚Ä¢	The beans, tomato, salad, and aioli were delicious and well-balanced, saving the plate from a total letdown.

The portioning across the plate was inconsistent ‚Äî some items felt generous, others almost tokenistic. The cost: $91 total, including a 15% Matariki surcharge (not unexpected, but it raised expectations that weren‚Äôt met).

Overall Experience

There‚Äôs potential here, especially for vegan kai lovers looking for a light, stylish brunch spot. But for us, the value just didn‚Äôt add up. The coffee is worth coming back for ‚Äî but not the full breakfast experience, not at that price, and not until they sort out the balance between staffing and service.

‚∏ª

Final Thoughts

Aesthetically pleasing but lacking in substance where it matters most ‚Äî flavour and service. We left feeling a bit underwhelmed

I was in Christchurch for a work meeting from Auckland, and by the third day, I was really craving some good Indian food ‚Äî and Himalayan Restaurant absolutely delivered! The food was amazing, full of authentic flavour, and I honestly can‚Äôt fault a thing. The staff were so friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Definitely coming back next time I‚Äôm in town!

We got a small group together for a neighbourhood meal and I was looking forward to a nice meal.  However the menu -as in all Indian Restaurants is so long I asked the waiter for a steer on a popular dish.  He recommrnded one of Chefs specials and I said yes.  It truly was so smoky, not the tandoor flavour but the liquid smoke that can be bought and so the meal could not be eaten. Three of us tried it, so it was a very disappointing experience.  Others enjoyed their meals.

We were only in Christchurch for 5 nights and ate here twice. The second time as a last minute group of 14, which the staff handled very well. The menu is large but the dishes maintain their authenticity, the food is top quality and the best we‚Äôve eaten in a long time. The service was very good, efficient and friendly with good attention to detail. All 14 of us highly recommend.

We held a 50th at Pink Lady and cannot recommend it highly enough. The location and outlook are already excellent, but added with the friendly, attentive staff, great selection of food and excellent range of cocktails, a wonderful evening was had by all of our guests (about 45), ranging from 18 years old up to mid 70's.
It's a unique place to hold a function in Christchurch, with an elevated view across the city and and a great vibe. We were looking for somewhere a bit different from the ordinary, and Pink Lady certainly provided!

Booked a table of 14 for my birthday dinner about 3 months before the date. When we arrived nobody came to offer us drinks, we had to go and ask even though there were 5 bar staff. The same with the food, then we were told when we finally got to order food that it would be a big wait because there is a big 50th birthday downstairs and they got the food pre ordered for 8.30. Why would you not come and tell us that sooner? My table was booked from 7pm FOR dinner, 3 months in advance. The food wasn't too bad, the calamari was inedible. The cocktails were yummy but this experience honestly ruined my 40th birthday, pretty sad about it.

The pastas were ok, quite bland though and the bread came out after we got pasta. Service was also slow and we got placed right next to the till and when asked to move the waitress was not helpful. I‚Äôve only ever had good experiences here so was quite disappointed :/

It could have been a great dinner, but it wasn't... It started with the waiter pouring us soda water without asking if we want soda or tap. The toilets are very unclean (we were at 17:30,so things couldn't get better after i think, and it was pretty bad). We ordered croquets for first, cocktails and for main we ordered the steak and gnocchi. At no point (not while given the menus nor when the order was taken) the waiters (different ones) bothered to notify us that the steak was not included in first table, like they do in other restaurants.

cocktails were very good, croquets not bad (had better but it were good). The mains arrived. The steak was good but relatively small and about 30 percent of it were hard fat. This is not something i would expect in a restaurant, definitely not for this price.

The gnocchi was excellent but the quantity of gnocchi was small (most of the dish was sauce, that was excellent but that's not the point). We had two more cocktails and finished with affogato which was good. As we paid, i realized the steak wasn't in the deal. I'm not the kind of person to argue so we paid and left. Overall our savings were 24$, definitely not worth it. In general, the whole experience was underwhelming and left a bitter taste. I wouldn't come again.

We found this restaurant by accident while wandering around town. It happened to be during Diwali, and the restaurant was absolutely buzzing with a joyous, constant line of customers that was moving quickly as sweets were flying out the door. It felt like an honour to witness it.

The take away menu is clearly marked with vegan options. We ordered the onion bhaji, mushroom pakora, dal tadka, aloo mutter & eggplant korma. The rice was complimentary. The onion bhaji were a little more dense & chewy than I am used to, but all of the food was genuinely delicious and we couldn't fault it. "Medium" heat for the curries was perfect for us, and the containers were generously filled. We'd definitely eat from here again!

He was there when we walked in.  After he made his order, I stood in front of the counter.  Waited.  And waited and waited.  What seemed like 7 or 8 mins.  No staff even looked in my direction or acknowledge that I was present.  I walked out.  Never would I ever come back.

Edit:  Thanks for your response.  I noticed the new staff.  But I was ignored by all your staff.  I was willing to wait.  But will not tolerate being ignored by all that worked there.

This is a very small restaurant that can house about ten tables. We ordered their pork ribs and two plates of red eye steaks. As we arrived at the restaurant very early, all the tables were empty. I was violently ill after eating ramen - with the exact symptoms listed for ingesting Staphylococcus aureus bacteria.

I recommend avoiding this place. Since the current owner took over, the quality has dropped and there have been some serious concerns about management.
According to recent news reports and comments, the labour laws are violated, staff were unfairly treated or even forced to take unpaid breaks during rostered hours, and even more worrying, the owner was caught selling recalled products that should have been removed from shelves for safety reasons. This seriously puts customers‚Äô health at risk.
The food quality is also not authentic compared to proper Japanese ramen. For example, the ‚Äúspicy miso ramen‚Äù uses Chinese chilli oil instead of Japanese seasoning, which is far from traditional flavour.
It‚Äôs also unusual to see some new 5-star reviews recently, which strongly makes me question the accuracy of the ratings.
To be clear, this review is only about the Colombo St branch. The Samurai Bowl on Wairakei Road is very different ‚Äì their ramen is authentic and much closer to Japanese standards, and I would recommend dining there instead.

I'm giving it a 1 for some good reasons. Originally gave it a 2 but the owners like to let their business down by trying snarky responses to reviews that they don't like instead of taking constructive criticism on board and fixing their own faults.

When we arrived we were greeted and sat and all was very friendly.
First thing we notice is everyone in the restaurant is just yelling so loudly that we couldn't even speak between ourselves. Way too loud and I don't know why. It was like this all night and my ears are still ringing the day after. For this I won't be returning.

The next thing is we sat for nearly 20mins eating for someone to come and take out order, even just for drinks. We were getting pretty pissed off by this point and was on the verge of leaving because we couldn't talk with it being so loud.

After a further nearly 20mins the food came and it was ok. The monkey bread was nice but was pricey just for a mini pizza....

The quesadilla was good.

The fried chicken was not. I've never had anything so oily in my life. I ordered the fried chicken sliders and it was just tasteless from the amount of oil onboard the chicken. No care from the chef. Just a basic thing to do...they need some basic chef training to learn how to not make the chicken drip with oil.

All in all waaaay too loud, too expensive and not that great...the artwork was cool though..you definitely get enough time to look at it because you can't talk because everyone was yelling.

We weren't the only ones that were complaining about the 2 large tables yelling and filling the entire restaurant with noise. Several others had the same feelings.

Never returning, not recommended.

This is our favourite Indian Restaurant in all of Chistchurch. The food is flavoursome & made with the  freshest ingredients.
The manager, Naveen is so friendly, kind & helpful and makes us feel so comfortable.
We look forward to returning soooon :)
~ Marcus & Tracey
Loved the naan, goat curry, and dum biryani! Naveen served us with amazing, quick service.
Food was quick, amazing, and the service was phenomenal.
Yum curry & lovely service

Always delicious, fantastic portion sizes, and great value for money with the combo deals. The staff are friendly and polite. Royal Tandoor Sydenham is the first place I think of when I'm wanting comfort food and I look forward to next visiting.
Great meal tonight from here, takeaway meals were great and enough for lunch tomorrow.

Got chicken korma takeout. Nothing like korma. A floury creamy tasteless sauce with no flavor or heat, with a few pieces of tough chicken floating along the bottom of the pottle. It was all sauce and did not resemble any Indian food I‚Äôve ever had. Poor and don‚Äôt recommend. Didn‚Äôt eat madras. Expensive slop for $51. Suggestion you go elsewhere!!! . (Papadum and nan was ok)

Got the butterchicken takeout dish. It had 3 pieces of chicken in the pottle, the chicken felt as it was heated in a microwave or something as rice was hot chicken was almost cold. Poor customer service when rung on feedback. Abused me on the phone and argued there was more than 3. Definitely poor rating & will definitely not recommend.

Would not order from here again, placed an  order over the phone and when I arrived at the restaurant I was charged an extra 12 dollars, turns out some of the menu on the website has incorrect prices to the Menu‚Äôs that are available in house. Food was also bad quality, the quality of the chicken is very disappointing, texture of it is dry and gritty. Would not recommend

Great okonomiyaki!

There's only 3 things on the menu, okonomiyaki (traditional.japanese pancakes), okonomiyaki styled fried noodles at yakisoba, and okonomelette which is an omelette with yakisoba inside instead of rice. Very creative and tasty. The queue is usually not long and serving fairly quickly compared to other busy stalls.

Always great food, coffee and service here.
Awesome! Delicious food & coffee. 100% recommend
You guys absolutely nailed it. Great food, service was fast and friendly, the overall decor to staff uniforms. All of it ticked the box.
Have been regularly going to Little Poms for about seven years now. The staff are amazing, the food incredible and coffee great. One of the best cafes in Christchurch!

went here twice, the first time we had hair on our food, we didn‚Äôt complain and just let it go. But the second time we visited, there was hair on our food once again, and I do not appreciate having hair on my food that I paid for. Please keep the dishes clean. Because of this I am giving it 1 star.
Absolutely thrilled with the tuna tinola! Delicious, exactly what I needed today. Preparation and delivery was lightning fast. Highly recommend!

We had the Tapsilog and Pork & Chicken Abodo. Both were delicious and well-presented. The complimentary soup was a welcome addition. We look forward to trying other dishes when we're in the area again at mealtime.

We had a booking for 4 so it was big outlay, the ride itself was enjoyable, but the main meals were below standard for the price. The Monk Fish main was simply awful.
A suggestion for the management is to take the orders and have them filled and brought onto the Tram in hot boxes on the second or third lap of the city so people have hot food not food that has been sitting on the bench after being plated.
Delicious meal, great service and beautiful (changing) view.

Apparently there are people who 'enjoy' leaving a meal feeling hungry. Not me. To me it is awful to spend so much on a meal and then end up wondering if the takeaways would be open on the way home. It would not be that hard to have more sides available, even given the logistics.
The gushy commentary might be appropriate to tourists but most of us seemed to be locals.
Luckily the company made the experience enjoyable.
Friends treated my husband to this wonderful experience just wish it was longer üòÇüòÇüòÇ

Worth the price of admission. The food was excellent, a testament to the chef who worked brilliantly in a very confined galley. Service was outstanding and Hannah couldn't do enough for us. And of course, the sights of Christchurch complemented the meal superbly. So, if you are ever in Christchurch, do yourself a favour and get onboard the tram.
Hilarious experience, we‚Äôve defined had better food, but for the novelty it was great!

I highly recommend C:MoMo and Chowmein ‚Äî it was absolutely delicious!
The host was very calm, composed, and welcoming ‚Äî it really added to the pleasant experience.
Another great meal with beautiful flavours

Best Lunch experience within 6 weeks traveling in New Zealand.
So kind people and simply the best dumplings I've ever eaten.

What a wonderful place! Incredibly fantastic, delicious food and hosts who make you feel like you don't want to leave, or at least want to come back again and again. With a joyful heart, thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è
Been wanting to try this out a while since I love dumplings and it was great! Maybe some acoustic foam would be a good idea since it's quite echoey, food was amazing and service really good too <3

As a Nepalese person myself, Yak&Fern is absolutely a gem and offers the most authentic Nepali food there is in Christchurch. The customer service is fantastic and the staff were absolutely welcoming. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you want to come back again and again. Highly recommend Yak & Fern to anyone who wants the authentic Nepali experience and flavour!

This became my new favourite place to eat in New Brighton!

The food is very good, full of different flavours. I have tried the mo:mo all the different possible ways (steamed, fried, in soup, etc...), their fried rice and fried noodles a I have never been disappointed.

I like that the interior is all modern, clean with large windows providing heaps of natural light.

Last but not least, the owners are amazing nice and friendly.

Make sure to visit them and encourage those initiatives in New Brighton.

Fantastic food value for money ,
We are pure vegetarian an they made us good veg nachos , veg burrito, veg quesadilla..
Got served old fish that stunk. This made our whole family sick, they need some education in food safety. The worst part is the staff couldn‚Äôt care less
If you like mexican,  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND coming here! Food was amazing!!!! Not to mention the tequila tasting board. Along with the sour apple feijoa and margaritas cocktail jugs!! Deliciouses!!!!
Atmosphere, vibe, staff, food; everything was amazing. Margaritas were exceptional. Definitely going back!

I‚Äôve been many times and have never had a bad experience but tonight had bad service and some bad food. Went for a friends birthday and it was an unpleasant experience
The Birria tacos were not good, my one was a cold and chewy as was my friends. The pork belly tacos were yum however and the fried chicken.
We also had 4 different issues with missing/incorrect items and when we politely asked for them to be fixed we were met with rude behaviours, not from all the staff but definitely a few. Not sure if it‚Äôs a change of owners or just bad service but I would not go on a Monday night again

Being from Texas, we are more demanding about our Mexican food. The chicken enchiladas of the day had spaghetti sauce on it! Very odd and not very good. Margaritas had no alcohol. A disappointment all round. Not recommended.

I visited in Mexico restaurant on Saturday night .place was really awesome because of restaurant located in Christchurch city center.
I placed the order chicken burrito , pork belly bite, beef nachos, really food was too yummy , delicious, i never had like this food in my life, i specifically thanks to chef‚Äôs team and thanks to Service team , they  give us Personalized Service , good attitude, also Margarita drink was really awesome .
Thanks to Mexico Christchurch team . I will visit again very soon .
And I recommend to everyone visit one time in Christchurch Mexico Restaurant.*****

The curry had great flavour but the meat wasn‚Äôt very tender. The service was bad, they took an hour and a half from when we got there, until we had food on the table. In there defence we were a big group but It had already been half an hour before they even took our order. If you are booking for a large group I wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

This is a review for the takeaway service.
Fast and friendly, the food was really satisfying and very good value for money. They have a large menu for traditional or vegetarian diets.
I would suggest a more sophisticated array of drinks.
I'll be coming back soon.

The wait time at this place is disappointing and after a long day if customers walk in to enjoy dinner they want and need to be served on time.
Walked in at 8.23pm and the food took one hour to arrive at the table. They take their own sweet time to prepare the food like there‚Äôs no tomorrow.
Quite disappointing experience and it was my first visit here wouldn‚Äôt come back for sure

I ordered off uber eats before looking at reviews. I was a bit on the wall with some good and not so good. Have always said dont knock it till you try it. I have to say, my food I got for myself was perfect. Medium heat üëå Portion size üëå Flavour üëå Temperature üëå There isnt anything I could fault. My garlic naan was soft, fluffy and tasty. Loved how my Mango Chicken wasnt sweet, and the chucks of chicken were nice decent bite size peices. My mums Chicken Korma was a wee bit too hot for her. Id ordered her medium. And for her tastebuds, not as creamy as shes used to having. Our first time trying and Id definately order again. Thanks team!!!

Medium means medium, not mild. Butter chicken is always a good tester for a new place and it was the best butter chicken I've had yet, real flavor and a little kick with the medium üëå is not the closest to me but I'll be back

We were a bit disappointed with our visit. The staff especially manager didn‚Äôt seem to care much about our dining experience, which took away from the overall atmosphere. The food was 45 minutes late and lamb curry still tasted like sweet and had a flavour that wasn‚Äôt quite what we expected. The chilli chicken was okay, but the butter naan was unfortunately half-cooked. Hopefully, the restaurant can improve the food quality and service in the future.
Delicious food, decent portion sizes and great service. Will be back again ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Absolutely loved our experience at Gunpowder Restaurant, From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel so welcome and looked after us like family. The atmosphere was cozy and vibrant perfect for a relaxed evening out.

The food was outstanding packed with authentic Indian flavours and cooked to perfection. Every dish we tried was bursting with taste, and the portion sizes were really generous too!

A special shoutout to the team for surprising the birthday boy with a chocolate naan and ice cream such a sweet and thoughtful touch that made the night even more memorable.

Hands down the best Indian restaurant in Christchurch can‚Äôt wait to go back again soon!
Mouthwateringly good Indian food. We ordered take away after a long day of travel and it was ready ahead of schedule, well packaged, and delicious. We are only in town for a few days but may be back!

First time in Christchurch, first restaurant we tried and my goodness, the food is absolutely beautiful, we all enjoyed every bit of it ü•∞ will definitely be back when we find ourselves back in the south island
Great restaurant, food and staff! Went twice and always had tasty food with a great service :)

Lovely place to sit and have some great thai food, especially the Pad Kee Mao. Wonderful lady served us was very kind and a great host.
Nice little family run place. Food is good, but not fiery like authentic Thai food. Recommended.

Greeted warmly on our arrival.
Menu's supplied with a smile when I explained we only wanted takeaways.
Food arrived promptly, and we were wished well on our way.
Absolutely delicious, sizeable portions, and I would happily return next visit to Christchurch.
We weren't there for the atomsphere, but the restaurant was clean and inviting.
Great food and service with very reasonable prices
Wonderful service and food was delicious will definitely be coming back
Good service from Kit and Maggie, environment and food are super nice.
Amazing dinner and service and very helpful
Had a great experience at the Ferrymead restaurant today,our service was quick and friendly, we will definitely be back!!
Staff were amazing and freindly and food was out fast
Dan was a great host. Food was well presented, plenty of options to choose from.
The food was delicious! I asked for the Kava curry lamb and really enjoyed it. Portions were very generous,  including the starters. I will highly recommend this place.
We had a really lovely time here. Loved the stuff and the food was delicious. Trying Kava was interesting. And I recommend the cauliflower dish.

What a wonderful place to dine, such a lovely homely warm atmosphere when we arrived, as well as a warm welcome.
The small group of us 4 had various starters and main courses.
We were all impressed with the high quality of food and service.
Definitely be back and highly recommend to all.
Don't let looks deceive you.  The food is amazing and the service impeccable. I can thoroughly recommend the chicken madras... this has become my new favourite Indian dish.

Best Indian food in Christchurch <3 soulful nourishing food, fresh ingredients, rich in flavour, amazing! Kava was great; we really enjoyed serving kava from the authentic bowl and sipping from coconut cups <3 love love love everything about this experience, will be telling everyone about this place and come back again soon. If you want proper Indian cuisine, this is your place.

Pacific kava restaurant first of all very good costumer service secondly very yammy food enjoyed every bite of my meal

Friendly, welcoming hosts greeted us as late arrivals and fed us delicious food. The garlic naan was something to write home about, we demolished every morsel of it! Our curries were delicious and portions generous. A most enjoyable meal!

Atrocious service. We were told to go to an outside table, but left after 20 minutes when no-9ne bothered to take our order.
The girls are fantastic üëè Walked in after 10pm and they couldn't have been kinder. Beautiful girls with such class, would recommend üëå
Beautiful and tasty cocktails

Amazing vibes! Beautiful location & great atmosphere. Mix of young and older crowd. But suited to everyone‚Äôs vibe.
Spectacular food!

I love sushi ya they are soo underrated I love the rice balls they r soo good,100% recommend

bussin sushi gonna try again

6 stars, no comments

That was a fantastic meal, and I don't say that lightly. I would re-order everything we had tonight and, while I didn't take a photo of every plate, let me just say that each of these tasted better than similar dishes I had at a 'higher end' restaurant the night before. I'd be more than happy to order just the croquettes for myself, but add the prawn linguini to it and it's so, so good. Our table also split a rib-eye which was cooked well to our temp, the pork mac & cheese, and the buttermilked fried chicken entree. Very happy with the cocktails as well.  Basically, happy with everything which is why I'm writing this to remind myself that YES I would come back again next time I'm in Christchurch.

i was impressed with the servings! we ordered two small plates to share and one large plate.. more than enough for two.

The cafe is inside the Fo Guang Shan Buddhist temple. Modern architecture building and nicely decorated inside. The foods are all vegetarian but very tasty üòã. They provide free water ( infused with lemon) which is very nice. Their high mountain tea is very good. Overall, great experience.
Hard to fault. Delicious variety of fresh food served in a serene atmosphere, this is a restaurant as much if not more than a cafe. Great for meetings with people you like , business or friends.
Exquisite. 5 stared delivery at everything. Water Drop VC deserves a Michilin.
I've been there many times and the food is always incredibly good. Very tasty and keeps you full for many hours.

What a lovely caf√©. The atmosphere is peaceful and welcoming, with a calm energy that makes it easy to relax. Staff are friendly and attentive.

The menu is full of fresh, nourishing vegan options, all beautifully prepared and full of flavor. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients and the mindfulness that goes into every dish. Portions are generous, and everything feels wholesome and satisfying without being heavy.

This caf√© is more than just a place to eat - it‚Äôs a little sanctuary. Perfect for anyone looking for delicious plant-based food in a beautiful, serene environment. Highly recommended.

We ordered takeaway tonight and asked for an Indian hot spice curry, not mild. Unfortunately, the curry tasted only sweet and tangy from the tomato with no spice at all. It didn‚Äôt taste like a proper Indian hot curry, and we were quite disappointed. We ended up eating something else instead. Not happy with our order tonight.
Amazing food with authentic flavors and great service! Cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommend this place for delicious Indian cuisine.
Wasn't just a meal it was an experience. Definitely coming back. Food was amazing
Tried their chicken biryani and it is so good. One of the best biryani I've tried.

Not very nice, taste has changed. Service was amazing but the food wasn't

Great Indian buffet had some of the best foods, ps have their yogurt based sauce otherwise it may have a bit of a kick to it

Lovely mela and great service
Great place for a lovely breakfast, food and coffee was great. Good vibes

With chefs who‚Äôve worked in a myriad of hotel kitchens the quality of the food from Town Tonic is balanced and fun in its flavours and presentation.
The attention, friendliness and care offered by the staff makes this a great place to eat in Addington whether breakfast, lunch or dinner.
PS great coffee too

restaurant: Nice Cook Chinese Buffet and Takeaway Restaurant

reviews.text: Stopped in to try their fish n chips out and feeling very disappointed and questioning what species of fish we were actually served up as it was tasteless , thinly cut and nothing like you would expect to get from your usual fish n chip shop . It wasn't enjoyable and I don't think I could trust 'nice Cook' and go back again unless they assured me they were serving up elephant fish or shark.

Best value for money that I have found in Christchurch.
This outlet has been going for a very long time out in Kendal Avenue,
Providing a snogesboard of dishes,
Over  the 25+ years that we have been going to Nice Cook, we have never once gone home unhappy or dissatisfied .
Best Value in the Northwest Christchurch Area - do try them.
I will be going back often.
This is a takeaway property and I am not aware of any dining in a dining in area.
Great chicken fried rice

Last few times we have been normally getting a tray of mixed food, it hasn‚Äôt been all that great. It seems pretty busy but the foods not all that fresh.
Sweet n sour pork- when you actually get some meat and not tonnes of vegetables the chunks are hard dry and yuck (like it‚Äôs been reheated)
Honey chicken , is a bit the same.
The sliced pork, is dry and wasn‚Äôt all that appetising
Rice and noodles- are flavourless and sometimes dry

Pretty disappointing as it‚Äôs not that cheap
Use to be yum not sure what‚Äôs happened.
I come from Linwood to buy their Chicken fries noodles. This is my favorite Chinese one anytime in Christchurch.
Best smorgasbord and fish n chips in christchurch! Been going there for 8 years

Bar tender Libby was great! Made us on off menu ‚ÄòDark & Stormy‚Äô cocktail that perfectly complimented the gloomy weather. It was also hilarious watching her sprint down the street after a customer who forgot his wallet, next level service!
The Quiz night was different from the usual ones I've been to. It was shorter but  a lot of fun. The food and cocktails were good as well.

We‚Äôve had the pleasure of hosting many singles events at Muy Muy, and the collaboration & experience has always been exceptional. The team consistently goes above and beyond, from helping generate interest to providing outstanding support before and during our events. The staff are always welcoming and professional, and our guests leave with smiles every time.

Muy Muy and the Double Dribble Group are very professional in the best way possible and we‚Äôre so grateful for their ongoing support in helping us build a vibrant singles community here in Christchurch. Highly recommend!
Great live music!
Meaty tacos=Muy muy is yum yum.

We visited on Halloween and loved it! The service was unexpectedly fast despite the crowd. The atmosphere was perfect, and the food was great. The margaritas were a bit too sweet and stronger than I expected üòÅ just my personal taste.

Had a lovely meal. Staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful.
Nothing like fresh food cooked in front of you, great for picky eaters who can customize their own meal.
We will definitely be going back often!!

We have been to Gengys a couple of times now. We book for 5:30pm to get in before the crowds.
There is a good selection of meat and veges for the chefs to cook and you should expect a wait time for your meal. While you wait there is also a selection of other food in the buffet.
The pancakes and ice cream for dessert are nice if you haven‚Äôt over done it on the all you can eat dinner.
Very great place üëè

We were there as a big group. The varieties of food were good. You grab what you like in a bowl, take it to the chefs and he will cook them in front of you while you wait in line. But limited dessert though. Could do with some cakes to finished up. Overall a great night out.
Cheers gengys...rubcore
Love the food and service at this place. amazing for birthdays and night out with your family

The food is amazing. and I understand that wait time is long for food because there was only 1 person running food and clearing dishes. but food is amazing. worth the wait tho. would come here again. I love the food, dont mind waiting.

Amazing food, 100% recommended.  I am choosy and these guys are awesome. Real, authentic Thai flavours; No weird chunks of carrot or celery, no gross frozen seafood mix, just real squid, prawns and mussels in the salads and tom yum  We got the whole fish in curry sauce and it was excellent. Super good and large portions.

Highly recommend the Tom Kha soup and Choo Chee Pla Tod Krob. We were so glad to find that all the seafood dishes were fresh ‚Äî not a single frozen seafood mix in sight! The service was also spot on. Unfortunately, we were too busy savouring the food and forgot to take photos. We‚Äôll definitely be back!
Fast service and great food! Didn‚Äôt have to wait long, and their garlic and pepper dish is an absolute must-have.

Yummy!!!! The flavours were amazing and the lunch specials are very worth it for the price, especially the noodles. Try the pandan coconut dessert - it has jackfruit in it and its not too sweet, just nicely balanced :)

Weeks ago I have tried this place but it lacked flavour.
Other thai restaurants are better, I like the atmosphere though.
The meal was very nice and tasty.

Tried a Thai restaurant recently that serves boat noodles‚Äînot something you see every day, especially for lunch! I ordered the Num Tok version, and the soup was rich, flavorful, and full of that signature Thai spice and aroma. For around $15, it‚Äôs a really affordable and satisfying option.

The portion was generous, and the toppings were nicely balanced. The only downside was the big rice noodles, which were a bit too soft and soggy for my taste. Still, overall a great find if you‚Äôre craving something warm, spicy, and different without breaking the bank.
Chinese meals are awesome, the fish, chips and burgers are absolutely horrible
Crazy good cooked resturant bro goes so hard. prices a bit high for the food but overall good.
Great chips and hotdogs, though the portions were small. Thanks New Wah.
Would not recommend nor buy from this place again, first time buying from uber eats.. and whole family got food poisoning .. I strongly question the hygiene and food quality of this place
Great meal. Highly recommend.

Great service & Amazing food.
Love this place.
Cool place to sit outside with a stein

We thought maybe this would be a great experience with the train type of dinning.
We have eaten sushi throughout the world and have experienced some amazing places.

To date‚Ä¶..this has been the worst sushi we have ever experienced‚Ä¶absolutely awful!!!! We couldn‚Äôt even finish what we had because it was that terrible‚Ä¶we were then told we would have to pay extra for not finishing this food and leaving it on our plates. That‚Äôs pathetic, this restaurant should be ashamed.
Honestly our recommendation would be to save your money or please eat somewhere else. We rate this place at a zero!
Terrible terrible. Meat and seafood was very dry. Seats were dirty. Booked for sushi train but there werent hardly any dish other than drinks.
Booked through bookme with 30% discount on sushi train. 3/4 of the train was empty. Not many to choose from except drinks. Fish and meat was very dry.

We came here for dinner today and the service was unbelievably poor. From the start we were ignored, waited ages for every dish, and the ramen we ordered as our main never even came ‚Äî while the table next to us, who ordered the same dish, got theirs half an hour earlier.

We had to get up every time to find staff, and when leaving, they still tried to charge us for the ramen that never arrived. We ended up leaving hungry and disappointed. As someone in the hospitality industry, this was honestly the worst service I‚Äôve ever experienced. This used to be one of our favourite places, but after tonight, never again.

We are very satisfied with the quality of the dishes Cookai prepared at our diner; very fresh ingredients including super fresh Sashimi plates; beautiful presentation and superb Flavours! Staff and the top chef are super friendly and attentive! Posted a few photos from our dining experience! This is the Best Japanese restaurant in chch central city, comparing this with the price you pay and the quality of the food you get, very cost-effective!

The food was brilliantly cooked and as soon as I walked in, we were seated and given a menu. The atmosphere was awesome and if someone else was with me, I would have been been able to talk and listen easily.
Been there 2 times and have had the same brilliant food, service, and atmosphere both times. Highly recomend this place.

One of the highlights of our visit to Christchurch was being able to visit multiple times and try various things here. It's absolutely phenomenal food and very lovely service too. If I visit Christchurch again, I will make sure I come back here.
Delicious food and very friendly customer services. Thili and the chefs are wonderful!

I don‚Äôt have a problem with the Food it‚Äôs delicious but For future reference if you have a bell üõéÔ∏è on your counter and you don‚Äôt want customers to use it to get service please remove it or have a sign saying you are closed or display a sign saying when you are open. I arrived at 9.45am your display units were full of cooked food lights all on at your counter lots of people eating in the food court. There were no staff at your counter when I used the bell that‚Äôs provided for service
Instead of two friendly faces coming to the front I got one guy I recognised who didn‚Äôt say anything and one guy I didn‚Äôt recognise snapping at me to wait a moment. They both disappeared round back and I never saw them again. Two women who were sitting came up to me and said they did the same thing and got a nasty response. Lucky for me they recommended the guys right next to your counter and they were fantastic friendly and the sweet soy chicken was delicious.
I know that you won‚Äôt care you didn‚Äôt get my money but I‚Äôm glad you didn‚Äôt and won‚Äôt get any of my dollars again. It‚Äôs not hard to be respectful to people especially those who support your business. Lastly always remember that every Action has a Reaction.

I had such a fantastic experience at Saviore Caf√©. The food was absolutely excellent ‚Äì fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavour. Every dish tasted like it was made with real care. This new spot is still finding its rhythm, so expect a bit of a wait‚Ä¶ but once that sizzling pot hits the table, you‚Äôll forget all about the delay.

‚ú® I ordered the Lup Cheong Claypot Rice ‚Äî topped with smoky Chinese sausage and crispy-bottomed rice, just like it‚Äôs supposed to be. Pour the soy sauce over and mix it up ‚Äî the aroma alone is enough to bring tears to your eyes üò≠

On the side: THESE CAME REALLY QUICKLY

üå∂Ô∏è Garlic Pork Belly (ËíúÊ≥•ÁôΩËÇâ) ‚Äî thinly sliced pork belly drenched in garlic-chili sauce. Cold, bold, and the perfect contrast to the hot claypot.
üç≤ Daily Soup ‚Äî loaded with carrots, mushrooms, bamboo, and pork. Comfort in a bowl.

üí°Heads up: It‚Äôs made fresh to order, so be patient (we waited 30+ minutes). But honestly? Zero regrets.

üí∞ Price: Around $15‚Äì20 per dish
üïê Tip: Dine in if you can ‚Äî the claypot crust doesn‚Äôt travel well!

Update:

They‚Äôve got BBQ now üç¢
Tried the chicken wings today ‚Äî crispy on the outside, tender and juicy inside ü§§
The aroma hits you hard, and the flavor just keeps pulling you in!
Best part? It‚Äôs super affordable!üî•
Pair it with a cold beer and you‚Äôve got the perfect combo üçª

üè† Hidden Gem: Unassuming Shop, Legendary Hainanese Chicken Rice üçóüçö

Sometimes the best food comes from the most unexpected places ‚Äî and this low-key little shop just proved that to me in the most delicious way.

üçó Chicken That‚Äôs Unbelievably Tender
The poached chicken was silky, juicy, and full of flavor. You can tell it‚Äôs been cooked with care ‚Äî no dryness, no toughness, just pure, melt-in-your-mouth perfection with a light chicken aroma.

üçö Fragrant Chicken Oil Rice
The rice is hands-down one of the stars of the dish. Cooked in chicken broth and oil, each grain is separate and glistening with flavor. Honestly, I could eat a whole bowl of just the rice!

üßÑ The Holy Trinity of Sauces
The classic trio ‚Äî ginger paste, chili sauce, and sweet soy sauce ‚Äî were all spot on. Balanced, homemade-tasting, and they elevate the chicken to another level when mixed and matched.

ü•¨ Bok Choy on the Side
Instead of the usual cucumber, this place served lightly blanched bok choy. Crisp, vibrant, and soaking in just a hint of that savory chicken flavor ‚Äî it was the perfect complement and added a homey touch.

üç≤ Comforting Soup Included
A bowl of hot, clean-tasting chicken broth comes with the set ‚Äî light but flavorful, and a lovely warm finish to the meal.

üìç From the outside, this shop might not catch your eye. But take one bite of their Hainanese chicken rice and you‚Äôll instantly know ‚Äî this is the real deal. No hype, no frills, just honest, heartwarming food done really well. Definitely a hidden gem worth discovering.

reviews.text: The food was great and friendly staff.  Will go back again

My wife and I went for dinner on our anniversary and I have to say, Mr. fussy here was very impressed. I had the Village Style Kleftiko and my wife had the Canterbury Lamb Platter, wow, I mean far out. The Kleftiko was absolutely stunning, so full of flavour and fall apart melt in your mouth chunks of lamb, we of course sampled each others and my wife's was stunning as well, she concurred. Of course we had to have dessert and this is what sets Costas apart from every other dinning experience I've ever had. You've just had a beautiful main and in our case an entre not to mention a couple of wines and you're beginning to feel a bit full but you'd like a dessert, something sweet to finish things off. Enter Costas mini desserts, what a brilliant idea, you don't have to pay the full price of a dessert and its just enough so you're not left with that I ate too much feeling. I had the Baklava Ice Cream and my wife had the Chocolate Mousse, both excellent. All in all, a fantastic experience, beautiful food, great atmosphere and good service. Highly recommend Costas, can't wait to go back.

First time dining at Thai Rendezvous for lunch. We were greeted by the friendly team and given a table quickly. Delicious authentic food and enhanced by fresh vegetables.  Highly recommend to anyone looking to dine in or takeaway - excellent parking is a bonus!

Had lunch at Thai Rendezvous and it did not disappoint! I ordered their Nam Tok‚Äìbased salad and it was absolutely outstanding. The grilled meat was tender and smoky, with just the right amount of spice and tang from the lime and chili. Fresh herbs and crunchy veggies balanced it beautifully ‚Äî every bite was refreshing yet bold in flavor.

The menu has plenty of tempting options (curries, noodles, and some great lunch specials), but if you‚Äôre after something light, vibrant, and packed with authentic Thai flavor, the Nam Tok salad is a must-try. Definitely one of the best Thai spots I‚Äôve been to in Christchurch!

The menu looks excellent and we chose to do the 89$ each trust the chef.
The menu states there will be some dishes from the menu and others just for the night. We were told by our server it was 4 courses.
Unfortunately we received only 2 dishes from the menu and the rest were off menu. Disappointing as if this was made clear to us we would've chosen to order separate to the trust the chef.
Some of the dishes from off menu were great but the sides with the main were extremely simple and not worth the money paid. A bowl of simple roast potatoes that were undercooked on the inside with a sparse amount of bland sauce and a bowl of nearly plain lettuce leafs.
One of the dishes we received from the menu was the focaccia which was delicious but we got one small piece each which again doesn't seem worth the money (on the menu the focaccia is $13 so i assume that ordering it not as part of trust the chef you would receive a more generous portion)
We calculated how much it would have cost to order all the dishes we wanted from the menu and it would've actually worked out cheaper than doing trust the chef.
We were also never told and it does not say on the menu that dessert was included in trust the chef (it became clear to us that this would be the 4th course when the 3rd course delivered was the main) there were no desserts listed on the menu given us. Two issues here - the main one being that I wouldn't have ordered dessert and therefore didn't factor this in to the cost of our decision and I didn't eat it. Secondly the dessert given was very small - about a 1/5th portion of a normal slice of cake with a mini scoop of gelato. Again poor value for money. (but at least my partner could easily consume both given the size)

In saying this - the beef main we were given was delicious, the drinks were good, the service was excellent and the vibe of the restaurant is lovely.

Our issue really is the value for money of the trust the chef and the poor reflection of the trust the chef compared to the menu - definitely give Odeon a try but my recommendation would be to order off the menu over doing the trust the chef.
